releases.name: 3884 Eligibility
releases.description: Form 3884 electronic tracking between Chief Business Office Purchased Care (CBOPC) and VISNs. The application provides a means for the business to communicate with VISNs on 3884A & B form statuses to expedite claims processes.

releases.name: 4Cast Financial Planning
releases.description: 4Cast is a resource planning tool used by medical center and VISN leadership to efficiently aggregate and prioritize the fiscal and non-monetary resource needs of individual facilities. 4Cast collects the individual business/operating plans by fiscal year for each service line within a VA medical center as documented by the Service Chief or a designated administrator. The information collected includes strategic and tactical objectives, FTE losses and gains, equipment and space requests. Additionally, workload data is used by the Services as a basis of estimate for future resource requests. Tracking progress via monitoring reports gives administrators accurate information to ensure that actual resource utilization maps to forecast plans. Intention of this site is to help VA plan and manage expenses.  Vendor website hosted on the Amazon cloud.  No PII or PHI is allowed, and a login banner states this to all users.  Access is protected by username/password.  The vendor is not allowed to use VA usernames,  passwords, or email addresses for validating access.

releases.name: 4-SIGHT Automated Eyeglass Ordering
releases.description: 4 Sight is an IT and business solution for the VA Prosthetic and Sensory Aids Service (PSAS) that promotes standardization of procurement of eyeglasses for veterans by using data to perform automation actions in VistA. 4 Sight is capable of decreasing the amount of open eyeglass orders; decreasing the amount of open eyeglass orders for greater than 30 days; and reducing the processing time associated with eyeglass ordering for prosthetics.

releases.name: Access Manager
releases.description: AM (Access Manager) a web-based application to allow assignment of roles or functionalities for certain portal applications to VA and external users.  This application also provides reporting on changes to user access/privileges.   An intranet application, used by limited VA employees and ISOs  A medium application, written in Java/html on Weblogic

releases.name: Activity Based Cost Project Portal
releases.description: Activity Based Cost (ABC) Portal is an approximately 15-year old system in use for tracking time against projects/activities. The ABC portal contains the information of approximately 1,200 FSC employees; Federal and Contractor employees.  We use the system to track labor hours by process/activity for FTE and contractors. The information is used to allocate labor expenses within our SAS CPM software.

releases.name: Administrative Data Repository
releases.description: The Administrative Data Repository (ADR) was established to provide support for the administrative data elements relative to multiple categories of a person entity such as demographic and eligibility information. Although initially focused on the computing needs of the Veterans Health Administration, the ADR is positioned to provide identity management and demographics support for all IT systems within the Department of Veterans Affairs.

releases.name: Advanced Medication Platform (AMPL) - Pharmacy Graphic User Interface (GUI)
releases.description: The Advanced Medication Platform Pharmacy Graphic User Interface (AMPL GUI) is a front end application supporting VA pharmacists by fulfilling the need for medical knowledge during the course of patient care. A lack of access to this medical knowledge can lead to suboptimal decisions, increased potential for errors and adverse events, decreased quality of care and health outcomes, less efficiency, increased cost, and decreased provider and patient satisfaction. Incorporating Graphical User Interface (GUI) capabilities into the processing of pharmacy medication orders is a way to minimize these risks and enhance healthcare. The Pharmacy GUI will support the current workflow, development and incorporation of new technology/functionality and techniques, and allow users to make more informed decisions, using clinical knowledge and patient specific information, intelligently filtered, organized, and presented as care is being delivered.

releases.name: Agent Cashier Accountability Automation
releases.description: The application will have multiple users at each VA location making deposits with Treasury.  The users will range from the Center Director, to the Agent Cashier with several other users at each location.  The application is designed to address external audit findings from several years ago.  It is designed to enable electronic submission and verification of documents validating VA accountability for public funds, as well as electronically submit monthly accountability reports to Central Office, as required by Treasury.

releases.name: Airborne Hazard Open Burn Pit Registry
releases.description: AHOBPR is a registry of Service Members and Veterans who were potentially exposed to airborne toxic chemicals and fumes from open-air burn pits and other sources in Iraq and Afghanistan. The registry consists of a database of registrants, their exposures and their heath conditions that may be clinically relevant to the diagnosis or treatment of the individuals or the monitoring of the target population. The registry is accessible from two web portals (a public portal and a VA staff portal) and include a reporting, analysis and data cube capability.

releases.name: Alert Creation Tool
releases.description: Internal investigation application that captures the research and communication done by NCPS after it identifies, and flags in SPOT, a patient safety vulnerability that is National, Enterprise in scope; Investigation work can result in a Patient Safety Alert that can be generated specifying action for each VHA facility to proactively remove or contain the vulnerability

releases.name: Alerts & Recalls Web Application
releases.description: Web application used for posting and tracking actions for facilities to take in order to protect patients (Patient Safety Alerts/Advisories and Recall Notices); accomplished by removing contaminated or otherwise harmful products from shelves, or by taking clinical actions to avoid a known vulnerability in the VA health care system.

releases.name: Amputee Registry
releases.description: FeldePL 110-417 was passed that requires a joint VA/DoD Extremities and Amputees Center of Excellence (CoE) with a registry will be needed to support the operations and outcomes tracking. In addition, Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF) accreditation is required for all Regional Amputation Centers and Polytrauma/ Amputation Network Sites as designated in VHA Handbook 1170.01. CARF requires that these facilities track the long term outcomes of patients treated functionality requested as part of this registry.

releases.name: Appeals RMS
releases.description: The Resource Management System (RMS) is a relational database and associated web application that will enable the Board to expertly manage and accurately report employee and resource data, both daily and strategically. It will also improve the Board's ability to deliver seamless and integrated support services across the enterprise business

releases.name: Applications for Visit Summaries Platform
releases.description: The Applications for Visit Summaries (AVS) Platform is a suite of related applications, developed by the VA, that provide summaries of the patient’s care in different settings. The flagship product of the AVS Platform is the After Visit Summary, which is a comprehensive summary of the patient’s health information for clinicians to print and provide to patients at the end of an outpatient visit. The goal is to improve the patient discharge process by making it easier for patients to comply with physicians' discharge instructions.

releases.name: Architected Solution Worksheet Estimator Tool
releases.description: Architected Solution Worksheet (ASW) Estimator Tool (ACT) is a custom developed Java tool for estimating the cost of hosting applications within the EO Data Center across the enterprise. It is a quick way to determine the cost before proceeding with a Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM) or Service Level Agreement Modification (SLAM).

releases.name: Assessing Social and Community Environments with National Data
releases.description: The primary objective of ASCEND is to develop a national survey that can produce valid, population-based estimates of suicidal behavior among U.S. Veterans. In addition to the creating new survey data collection system, we aim to identify data sources and mechanisms for integrating the ASCEND system with other complimentary, existing data systems. This survey aims to: (1) Serve as a national surveillance system to document prevalence and trends over time in suicidal behavior across the life of a Veteran and (2) Provide estimates of the impact of risk and protective factors (e.g., social determinants of health, social capital, and interpersonal needs) on suicidal thoughts and suicide attempts among Veterans. This project will focus on the Veteran population as a whole, not only those using VHA services, and will inform policy and service development, and improve the quality of Veteran suicide prevention programs. The software program used for the ASCEND project is called Mirah. Mirah is a survey administration, measurement feedback and data collection system designed specifically for Measurement Based Care (MBC) in the behavioral health space. The SaaS application is HIPAA compliant and enables health care providers to easily and flexibly administer measures of mental health and overall well-being. Mirah tracks response rates, automatically scores completed measures, and delivers real-time feedback reports. Through serial administration of measures, Mirah can track patient symptoms and distill response data into clinical insights.

releases.name: Attachments Retrieval System
releases.description: ARS is a new system that will serve as a processing system and central repository for electronicattachments. It will contain a parser that will process incoming transaction batches from theHCCH, validate them, save them to the ARS database, save information to the ProgramTracking/Central Server database for distribution to FBCS, and create acknowledgement batchesfor return to the HCCH. It will allow searching and viewing of attachments in its own web-basedGraphical User Interface (GUI) and allow those attachments to be identified and linked to frominside EWV and FPPS. In addition, the IDs of received attachments for a claim will be sent toVistA Fee Basis through FBCS (via Central Server) so that claims adjudicators will have anindication that there are attachments to view for the claim that they are working. (The FBCSindicator is being added in a parallel development effort.) In addition, ARS will notify the EDIteam via an Outlook mail group when attachments are received that cannot be linked to aclaim.

releases.name: Audit Recovery Portal
releases.description: Provides a user-friendly interface to the station to let users take actions, such as updating status and billing information, for the duplicates for their station. The AR Portal also provides the capability to create Bills for Collection to collect duplicates payments identified in the application. The AR Portal does not have the ability to interact with FMS directly(create records) so it is integrated with the Bills for Collection Portal (BFC).AR Portal uses payment history and unpaid voucher data on a daily basis to identify improper and/or duplicate payments in direct disbursements, unpaid voucher, and payment history. It is one of the many FSC systems that interact with FMS through the bi-directional “PC Interfaces”. It receives files from FMS.

releases.name: Automated Eligibility Tool
releases.description: The Automated Eligibility Tool (AET) is a system for responding to ASC X12N 5010 Health Care Eligibility Benefit Inquiry and Response (270) transactions in real time for the Fee Basis program. It provides a gateway through which Emdeon, the health care clearinghouse that works with the VA, can return eligibility data for Veterans from VA systems to providers that request it. This approach allows the VA to maintain its data without having to store it in Emdeon s hosted database.

releases.name: Automated Monument Application System
releases.description: AMAS is the Automated Monument Application System that automates all business processes associated with monument ordering, delivering, and tracking. It provides for the creation and maintenance of a complete historical record for each monument application. AMAS receives, processes, and tracks over 335,000 applications each year for government furnished monuments (i.e., headstones, markers, niche covers) for graves of veterans and beneficiaries buried in National, State Veterans , Arlington National Cemetery, post/military, Department of Army, Department of Interior,  and private cemeteries. AMAS is considered an NCA Mission critical system.

releases.name: Automated Notification Reporting Tool
releases.description: The ANR Tool is a web-based application that allows VA personnel in the field to report IT resource outages and service disruptions both scheduled and unscheduled, as well as other information to the VA Service Desk for dissemination.

releases.name: Automated Sales Reporting
releases.description: Canteen daily reporting of sales and receipts to back office system

releases.name: Automated Standardized Performance Elements Nationwide
releases.description: Automated Standardized Performance Elements Nationwide (ASPEN) system.  Means of performance management tracking includes the implementation of new Veterans Services Representative (VSR) standards.  It also allows employees to view their own performance.

releases.name: Banking Info
releases.description: Per meeting with Jason Pirkey current project manager for FPPS (VASI ID #1265) and Jim Hughes former project manager for FPPS on 12 February 2018, this has always been a component and never should have been entered as its own system.  It is therefore marked INACTIVE and has been added as a component of FPPS. Federal Personnel Payroll System (FPPS) utility (FPPS UTIL) which manages the bank information used for claims processing.

releases.name: BDN - Compensation & Pension Payment System
releases.description: Compensation and Pension (C&P PAY) provides Veteran claims status and payment history information on their compensation and pension claims. Subsystems include: On-line, Claims Establishment, Claims Development, Awards, Dependency, FISCALS, Income, Ratings, BEVR, Legislation, ATA, Batch, Special Pay, Input Runs, Main Update Run, Audit Trail, Accounting, Treasury, FMS, NOES, Statistical Reports, CARS, Letters, Legislation, Intra-agency data exchanges (IRS, SSA, RRB, VHA, etc.), and ATA.

releases.name: Bed Management Solution
releases.description: The Bed Management Solution (BMS) is a real-time web-based interface that will have dependencies on Medical Domain Web Services (MDWS), VistA Access Enhancements (VAE), Identity & Access Management (IAM), Emergency Department Information System (EDIS), Fee Basis Claims Systems (FBCS), National Utilization Management Integration (NUMI), Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VISTA) and InfoWorld Inflow Software Product as provided by MedicaSoft, LLC. BMS resides on virtual hardware at the Austin Information Technology Center (AITC) Austin, TX. BMS is a tool designed to track patient movement and determines bed availability to optimize the flow of patients from admission through discharge, and to improve patients’ safety, quality of care, and customer satisfaction which ensures that after admission, patients are placed in beds that meets their medical needs as soon as possible. The main purpose of this effort is to enhance current application functionality and reporting capabilities, to implement the use of the Master Veteran Index (MVI) to provide essential seamless care coordination and data sharing, to implement Personal Identification Verification (PIV) sign-on capabilities is based on VA privacy and security guidelines, and improve efficiency of middleware usage.  Network communication is realized using the HTTP and/or HTTPS protocol.  All the communication between BMS, MDWS (NOTE: scheduled to be replaced by VistA Integration Adapter (VIA)), VistA, and National Utilization are done via TCP.

releases.name: Beneficiary Identification Record Locator System
releases.description: BIRLS is a 44+ million computerized record system containing basic identifying information on a VA claimant including current location of the claimant's folder and service information.  BIRLS controls the assignment of file numbers, manages 10 different folder types, stores inactive compensation and pension data, and stores active and inactive insurance policy numbers.  The BIRLS database file is stored on an IBM Mainframe computer at the Corporate Franchise Data Center (CFDC; formerly, Austin Automation Center or (AAC) in IDMS database format. The BIRLS data is maintained by the Austin Automation Center (AAC) and are directly accessible to authorized users.

releases.name: Benefits Assistance Services Outreach Reporting Tool
releases.description: The Outreach Reporting Tool (ORT) was built as an OIT system to keep track of all of VA outreach events in order to report Bi-Annually to Congress.  The Secretary of Veterans Affairs uses our ORT report to provide and meet that Title 38 USC requirement.  There are 5 Districts and 57 Regional Offices, and 1680 users VA wide that use ORT daily.  It took 2 years to build and it has been in production for the last 2 years.

releases.name: Benefits Delivery Network
releases.description: The Benefits Delivery Network is a suite of COBOL mainframe applications that collectively make up the VA s primary claims processing, tracking and payment system.  The BDN tracks and distributes approximately $40 Billion in veteran entitlements yearly. BDN Benefits Delivery Network is the primary database and payment system for all education benefit programs administered by Education Service. VBA employees use BDN for the purpose of determining eligibility for benefits as well as processing benefit payment transactions.  BDN processes claims for all Education benefits including Ch 30, Ch 1606, Ch 1607, Ch 32, Ch 35, and soon to be Ch 33 interim solution.

releases.name: Bill for Collection Portal
releases.description: This is a web-based application used to create bills for collection. It is one of the many FSC systems that interact with FMS through the bi-directional “PC Interfaces”.Creates a receivable for a vendor in the case of overpayment, duplicate payment or incorrect payments. It creates an FMS receivable (BD transaction) and offset (PV03 transaction). In addition, it allows a user to enter a bill for credit memos that vendors send.  FMS processes the receivable activity (e.g. collections) and subsequently updates the BFC portal from FMS.

releases.name: Blind Rehabilitation/VIST
releases.description: The Blind Rehab application provides enhanced tracking, and reporting, of the blind rehabilitation services provided to veterans by: Visual Impairment Service Teams (VIST), Coordinators Blind Rehabilitation Centers (BRCs), Blind Rehabilitation Outpatient Specialists (BROS), Visual Impairment Services Outpatient Rehabilitation (VISOR), ProgramsVisual Impairment Center to Optimize Remaining Sight (VICTORS). Features include: Electronic referral process to track patient applications for service, Notifications feature to alert users of pending referrals, Encounters/Progress Notes will be automatically created, Nationwide centralization of Blind Rehabilitation services data to allow nationwide reporting, Ad-hoc reporting capabilities, Allows ability to track BR patient care access across institutions, Patients can be referred or transferred to other institutions if they move without having to recreate patient data.

releases.name: Breast Cancer Clinical Case Registry
releases.description: Breast Cancer Clinical Case Registry facilitates the monitoring and tracking breast cancer and diagnostic test result, facilitate coordination of care, and improve management and timeliness to treatment for the Office of Public Health and Environmental Hazards and the Women Veterans Health Strategic Health Care Group. Currently there is no system in place in the Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS) that has the capacity to identify, monitor and track all women with normal or abnormal mammogram results and assess sequential milestones in the diagnostic work up and treatment.

releases.name: Budget Tracking Tool
releases.description: The Budget Tracking Tool (BTT), an integrated enterprise-wide budget planning, management and reporting system, was used to plan the annual budget at the obligation level and to manage execution and funds resource allocation through the end of the year. BTT springs from HPTi which was High Performance Technologies Inc., the original company that developed the application.  HPTi was acquired by DRC a few years ago, which was then acquired by Engility. Current documentation in the code for the FMS interface with BTT still refers to HPTi and HPT. BTT takes a daily download (in the morning hours) from FMS that helps us track our detailed budget operating plan (a detailed spend plan) of about 4,000 non-pay lines plus the pay data by BOC/SOC. The flat file is processed as soon as it arrives by an automated job that goes line by line and inserts it into the main application database. Strict adherence to the file format is necessary for processing to succeed.

releases.name: Burial Operations Support System
releases.description: BOSS is the Burial Operations Support System which automates all the manual, paper intensive record keeping, and information and forms processing associated with over 100,000 yearly interments from National, State Veterans, Arlington National Cemetery, post/military, Department of Army, and Department of Interior cemeteries. BOSS provides for the creation and maintenance of a complete historical record for each interment and is considered an NCA mission critical system.

releases.name: Burial Vault Payments
releases.description: System is used to process the Burial Vault reimbursement records provided by the NCA. Every Monday the application downloads a text file of veteran burial records from the NCA BOSS system, imports the file into a SQL Server database, checks for missing and duplicate information, inserts additional information, and outputs the records in a FMS format for transmission to FMS.

releases.name: Business Information Office Business Intelligence Solution
releases.description: When Veterans receive care from VA for non-service-connected conditions, VA is allowed to bill the Veterans' private health insurers and retain these third-party collections to supplement its appropriations for health care. In addition, VA may also bill and collect co-pays from a number of Veterans who receive non-service-connected care or prescriptions from VA medical facilities. VHA established Chief Business Office (CBO) in 2002 to the processes to bill and collect, provide corporate oversight, and further professionalize healthcare revenue activities. Since 2003, CBO's POWER reporting system (POWER/POWER PLUS) has supported VHA's efforts to improve performance in its revenue collections business operations by providing accurate, reliable, and up-to-date outcome and performance measure information. The performance information in POWER/POWER Plus has allowed VHA management to create reports to manage, analyze, and monitor metrics for revenue tracking, yielding over $3 billion per year. The performance of this system and its reporting capabilities are critical to maximizing revenue collections. Inconsistency or variation of data will negatively impact revenue collections, which would result in a reduction of funding provided to VA medical centers and ultimately negatively impact the Veterans with regard to obtaining healthcare service. Therefore, it is critical to maintain technical expertise and continuity of services to reduce variation in reporting and minimize the risk for inconsistent and/or inaccurate data analyzed by high echelon Government personnel and utilized in budgetary planning and decision-making as well as revenue collection. Over the years, dependency on the POWER/POWER Plus reports has grown. In order to keep up with the demand of emerging requirements and management's need for transparency, CBO needs to expand and enhance the current system. POWER/POWER Plus is resting on a legacy platform and outdated software.  This system will be replacing PowerPlus #1505. In order to provide for expansion, accurate and reliable information, the Business Information Office (BIO) has begun creating a new enhanced reporting tool (mPOWER) in a Cloud environment.  Infrastructure project is BIO Business Intelligence Solution (BIO BIS).

releases.name: Camp Lejeune Family Member Portal
releases.description: The Camp Lejeune Family Member Program (CLFMP) system processes medical claims for family members who have been accepted into the Camp Lejeune Family Member program for medical care associated with medical conditions resulting from residing at Camp Lejeune, NC. It is built around the Plexis Claims Management (PCM) COTS application. FSC will receive, process, adjudicate, and pay medical, dental, and pharmacy claims for eligible Camp Lejeune family members through the CLFMP system. CLFMP medical claims are received from health care providers as Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) transactions and will be imported into the Plexis Claims Manager (PCM) system. Paper claims can also be sent by health care providers or Camp Lejeune family members, and they will be converted to EDI transactions by Claimsnet, who is the FSC contracted clearinghouse, whenever possible. For paper claims sent on the CLFMP non-standard claim form or ones that fail to be converted to an EDI transaction, the FSC Operations team will manually add the claim in PCM. FSC also provides through the CLFMP system reporting capabilities for CBO as well as two web portals that will allow for the capture of family member applications and a workflow solution for managing administrative and clinical eligibility determinations.

name: Capacity Management Database
description: The Capacity Management Database (CMDB) is designed to track computer resource usage of the computer hardware running Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA). Information derived from CMDB is used to assess the impact of planned new software products, identify the ramifications of archiving and purging of existing data, recognize emerging problems through database analysis, and validate sizing model expectations. Data for CMDB is captured from all VistA systems in real time. Accumulated data is processed at each site and the results are transmitted to CMDB using MailMan messages. Data can be added to CMDB daily, along with the monthly updates. On a monthly basis, reports are sent to the Chief Information Officers (CIOs) of the Veterans Integrated Service Networks (VISNs) and Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC) CIOs to allow review of the system's performance and identify future problems (e.g., lack of available disk space). IT personnel can access the database through the VA's intranet (http://vaww.va.gov/capman) for comparison of their system with other sites. The users of CMDB include the VA Office of Information & Technology, VISN CIOs, and facility CIO staff.

name: Capital Assessment Process
description: The Capital Assessment Process (CAP) system collects, maintains, and reports information on IT Assets.  CAP consists of a web application interface, SQL Server database, and Microsoft Reporting Service reports.  Data is input into CAP annually by all facilities/organizations within the department.  Total assets are reported into CAP to provide a snapshot of the IT infrastructure.

name: Capital Asset Inventory
description: The Capital Asset Inventory (CAI) is VA's real property/capital inventory system, which records land, buildings, structures, leases, and agreements across the Department. The CAI includes descriptive information about each real property asset, such as the age, condition, and location of owned buildings. It also captures the departmental space associated with owned and leased sites, as well as the Facility Condition Assessment (FCA) data for each owned building and structure. The system is web-based and is utilized by 1,500+ users across the Department, generally engineering, capital planners, and other facility related staff.In response to Executive Order (EO) 13327, VA reports annually to OMB and the General Services Administration on the Department's inventory and real property performance as defined below:- Federal Real Property Council Inventory Data- Annual Facility Performance Metrics- Facility Utilization Index- Facility Condition Index- Annual Facility Operating Costs- Mission DependencyThis EO broadly refers to promoting the efficient and economical use of America's real property assets and assuring management accountability thereof. Its implementation in the VA enables top leadership to make decisions on construction of future medical centers and disposal of unused buildings, as the veteran population shifts, among other things.  CAMS and CAI are the IT systems used to record and store that data, and generate reports for internal customers, Federal agencies, and the US Congress.  NOTE: CAMS is an umbrella term used by OI&T to group systems such as CAI and CAMS-BI together – there is no physical software directly called “CAMS”.

name: Caregivers Application Tracker
description: The CAT is a stand alone application that the Caregivers Support Program and the CBO for Purchased Care uses to accept and track veteran caregivers applications and stipend payments.  The CAT is currently undergoing a Rescue effort via a T4 contract to move it out of the HEC/ATC into the Enterprise Operations environment.  The CAT will experience a data cleanup, a stipend data migration and some enhancements before being placed into the EO production environment.

name: Caregivers Tool
description: Deployment of the new Caregivers Tracking Application (CareT) will begin in December 2016 and provide the following functionality; Ability to support primary, secondary, and general Caregivers; Supports the business needs of the Caregiver Support Phone Line; Coverage of the end-to-end primary and secondary Caregiver process including; the submission of a Veteran and Caregiver application; providing ongoing Veteran and Caregiver support and monitoring; the calculation of streamlined stipend payments including the annual labor rate update process; the revocation of a Caregiver from the program and termination of benefits; Improved data tracking and information sharing amongst VA personnel; Improved data integrity and increased ability to respond to Congressional inquiries and reporting requirements.

name: CBA Reconciliation VA TDY Travel Reconciliation
description: This application is used monthly by the field station accounting and travel groups to provide field stations data on Unused Tickets and unmatched transactions for travel purchases made using their Centrally Billed Account.  The portal is used to reconcile Unmatched CBA transactions and the field stations may review any Unused Airfare tickets for their personnel and use any credits for future travel. and Unmatched Transactions are reconciled, approved, submitted for Certification and reconciliation is Certified by station CFO or designated Certifying Official.

name: Center for Medicare/Medicaid Services Health Management Systems Veterans Benefits Administration Tracker
description: Data matching tracking for CMS/HMS/VBA claims.

name: Central Database System
description: At a high level, Central Database System (CDB) is a web-based application utilized by the Pharmacy Benefits Management (PBM) Services to provide a seamless business solution for monitoring adverse drug events (ADEs). CDB is comprised of Web Services, SQL databases, third party services for moving workload, and SQL Archive system for historical data and reporting.

name: Central Fee System
description: FEE Basis Treatment/Central Fee System authorizes and pays private physicians, hospitals (in-patient) and pharmacists for products and services dispersed to approved Veterans for non-VA care. This system also reimburses Veterans for medical care and travel. Also known as Central Fee. This is the centralized receiving point for the VistA Fee Basis application. It provides money management for all payments. Central FEE maintains a complex bi-directional interface with FMS, including direct access to vendor and payment information. Vista Fee (weekdays) Via DMI 100k + records Payment data, Veteran and Vendor adds and update information. FMS transmits payment, treasury vendor file information messages to Central FEE Central FEE transmits pharmacy and medical vendor records to FMS.

name: Central Information Processing System
description: The Central Fee system provides a data file system and a historical database for payments made using Vista Fee.  Central Fee processes payments, generates reports, Explanation of Benefits (EOB) letters, and maintains Historical data for payments made.  Central Fee additionally provides SAS files to other national systems such as DSS, VSSC and IG for statistical analysis and monitoring. The system is centralized at the Austin Information Technology Center (AITC) in Austin, Texas on the Mainframe.

name: Central VistA Imaging Exchange
description: Provides a single point for VA access to DoD Images. CVIX uses the VistA system at Station 200 to provide VA treating facility information for shared patients and temporary VA credentials for DoD clinicians.

name: Centralized Accounts Receivable System
description: DMC’s Centralized Accounts Receivable Systems (CARS) sends a nightly and monthly AR batch file to FAS.The CARS/CAROLS application is as a subordinate system to BDN/VETSNET focused on the identification, tracking, and collection of debt owed by eligible Veterans and/or their dependents. The system receives input from Hines and may enter additional information as each case is worked. Checks are entered for processing at the St. Paul Debt Management Center (DMC). Depending on the type of data entered, processing may occur via batch or online. In both cases the electronic data is transmitted to the VA Philadelphia site where it is routed onto the primary electronic backbone and on to the AITC. CARS maintains information of government overpayments, accounts receivables to the Claimants.

name: Centralized Accounts Receivables On-Line System
description: The CARS/CAROLS application is as a subordinate system to BDN/VETSNET focused on the identification, tracking, and collection of debt owed by eligible Veterans and/or their dependents. The system receives input from Hines and may enter additional information as each case is  worked. Checks are entered for processing at the St. Paul Debt Management Center (DMC).  Depending on the type of data entered, processing may occur via batch or online.  In both cases the electronic data is transmitted to the VA Philadelphia site where it is routed onto the primary  electronic backbone  and on to the AITC. Processing and electronic data storage occurs at the AITC with backups periodically generated and stored remotely. Hot-sites are available for use should they become necessary.

name: Centralized Administrative Accounting Transaction System
description: CAATS is a web-based automated system that allows for the electronic input and approval for accounting source document/transaction, improvement of internal controls standardization of accounting entries, electronic audit trail, and separation of duties.  It is the central interface to the Financial Management System(FMS) for both Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) and National Cemetery Administration (NCA).  There are currently 18 modules in CAATS.NOTE: This current capability will be replaced by VBMS EM; and will be decommissioned once new capability has been launched in production.

name: Centralized Property Tracking System
description: [10/3/16 - Per James Whited (Manager, Loan Guaranty Support), The Centralized Property Tracking System (CPTS) was decommissioned on September 9th...and all functionality can now be found in the Web Loan Guaranty (WebLGY) system.] CPTS is a Web-based system that provides LGY s  Property Management Oversight Unit (PMOU) in Nashville, TN, with the information it needs to monitor the progress and performance of the contracted property management service provider in managing and selling VA properties and to process sales proceeds.  CPTS is accessible to VBA employees only.  Employees log in through and are authenticated by VIP.  Once the authentication process has been successfully completed, the employee will access CPTS via a menu of options on the left-hand side of the web page.

name: CHAMPVA Regulatory Updates
description: The Civilian Health and Medical Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs (CHAMPVA) is a health benefits program in which the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) shares the cost of covered medical care services and supplies with spouses, children, survivors, and certain caregivers of veterans who meet eligibility criteria under 38 U.S.C. 1781. CHAMPVA beneficiaries must not be eligible for TRICARE, but section 1781, stipulates VA shall provide for medical care in the same or similar manner and subject to the same or similar limitations as medical care is furnished to certain dependents and survivors of active duty and retired members of the Armed Forces under chapter 55 of title 10 [United States Code] (CHAMPUS). 38 U.S.C. 1781(b). This rulemaking is intended to ensure that VA regulations continue to be, broadly speaking, the same or similar to the regulations and policies governing TRICARE standard. CRU is a web-based application developed specifically to support new federal regulations stipulated each January. The application clarifies and updates these regulations to conform to changes in law and policy that control CHAMPVA and includes details concerning its administration which not reflected in current regulations. The application supports expanding covered services and supplies to include certain preventive services and eliminate cost-share amounts and deductibles for certain covered services.

name: Chapter 1606 - Montgomery GI Bill Selected Reserve - Benefits Payment System
description: Chapter 1606 assists eligible reserve servicemen to further their post-high school education by providing educational assistance in approved education and training programs. This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) interfacing with US Treasury, that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for servicemen that are eligible under this program. Sends summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Chapter 1607 - Reserve Education Assistance Program
description: Chapter 1607 provides educational benefits to members of the Selected Reserves, Individual Ready Reserve, and National Guard who are ordered to active service. This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for servicemen that are eligible under this program.A web based application used by VBA Education Service and RO officials to verify the eligibility of specific reservists to receive educational benefits under Ch. 1607.  This application is a temporary measure to obtain and display REAP eligibility data from DoD until the data can be obtain via VADIR. Chapter 1607 is a system for Selected Reserve members who served 90 or more days of active duty service after September 11, 2001.  Chapter 1607 was developed as a clone of the CH30 system and was deployed to users in February 19, 2006.  In Chapter 1607, central data base masters are updated upon authorization of the award.  On-line processing generates payment records for Treasury and Letter records for subsequent printing on the Xerox 9700.  CH1607 generates complete audit trail records.  It updates history segments in the master records, which can be viewed on-line. Chapter 1607 is processed at four Regional Processing Offices (RPOs) located in St. Louis, Muskogee, Atlanta and Buffalo.  Currently Chapter 1607 benefit processing runs five times a week (Monday through Friday).  Treasury records are generated and mailed to Treasury on the same day that an award is adjudicated and/or Certified.  Chapter 1607 on-line runs on a separate TP on the TCS for performance considerations of the overall on-line system.

name: Chapter 18 - Spina Bifida
description: Makes payments for CH 18 (Spina fide) claim awards as part of the BDN System interfacing with US Treasury.

name: Chapter 30 - Montgomery GI Bill Active Duty Benefits
description: System in support of Chapter 30, Public Law 98-525. This system processes CH30 benefits for flight, apprenticeship, correspondence and on-the-job training programs for veterans.  It is operational at the four CH30 Regional Processing Offices (Atlanta, Buffalo, Muskogee, and St. Louis). Chapter 30 is a contributory system for Veterans who entered military service after July 1, 1985.  This is the fastest growing Education system.  Chapter 30 was designed to offer much more on-line functionality than previous systems.  In Chapter 30, central data base masters are updated upon authorization of the award.  On-line processing generates payment records for Treasury and Letter records for subsequent printing on the Xerox 9700.  CH30 generates complete audit trail records.  It updates history segments in the master records, which can be viewed on-line.  Chapter 30 eligibility is determined via query of the Defense Manpower Data Center (DMDC) database, which is received from DOD at Monterey and maintained at Hines, unlike other systems, which use BIRLS to determine eligibility.  This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for individuals that are eligible under this program.  Provide summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Chapter 31 - Vocational Rehabilitation and Counsel
description: Vocational Rehabilitation and Education (VR&amp;E, Chapter 31). Also this system supports Chapter 31 Future Recurring Adjustment, which is a process interrogates the future recurring data for the Chapter 31 (CH31) education benefit to determine if future recurring data (recurring payment) should be made current.This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for individuals that are eligible under this program.Sends summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Chapter 32 - Veterans Education Assistance Program
description: This Public Law was designed to provide educational assistance for Post Vietnam Era Veterans, those veterans that entered duty after December 31, 1976.  Its purpose was to assist service persons in obtaining an education they might not otherwise be able to afford and to be used by the services as a recruitment aid. These benefits are available to all persons who enlisted in the following seven branches of service -- Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, Public Health Service, and NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration). This system is updated by contributions the service person makes toward his/her education after the first enlistment or upon discharge.  The Government contributes two dollars for every dollar contributed by the service person. The money is recorded in the Banking System until the person applies for and receives an award through the Benefit System in the form of a payment for educational assistance. The maximum amount of money the service person can contribute is $2,700.00 at an increment amount of no less than $25.00 or more than $100.00 each month.This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for individuals that are eligible under this program.Provides summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Chapter 33 - BDN
description: Provides education benefits for service members who served on active duty for 90+ days since 9/10/01. CH33 BDN System processes the payment requests received from CH33 LTS and provides acknowledgement.  CH 33 is hosted at Terramark. Transmits CH33 summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Chapter 35 - Dependents Education Assistance
description: Chapter 35 Benefits included low-cost mortgages, low-interest loans to start a business or farm, cash payments of tuition and living expenses to attend college, high school or vocational education, as well as one year of unemployment compensation. It was available to every veteran who had been on active duty during the war years for at least ninety days and had not been dishonorably discharged; combat was not required. This system provides payments to entitled widows, and orphans while attending a college or other authorized training institution.Chapter 35 provides education and training benefits to veterans’ dependents. This is part of the VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) that sends data to FMS in order to make payments for individuals that are eligible under this program.Sends summary level accounting to FMS.

name: Charge Card Portal
description: Used to meet the demands of the Charge Card Abuse Prevention Act of 2012 and streamline the process by electronically routing the forms to potential cardholders. Employee as charge card holder will fill application online to acquire a new charge card. CCP is a Pega app used for Purchase, Convenience Check, and Fleet cards and their transactions.  CCP also checks all card training including users that have Travel cards.

name: Charge Card System
description: CCS provides an interface to the credit card provider and automates paying invoices and making accounting changes to the purchases listed on the invoice.  CCS provides invoice and payment information to FMS. CCS application processes when requested by FSC. CCS system creates a flat file to record transactions in FMS that were paid outside of the FMS system.

name: Chemotherapy Order Management System
description: The COMS application supports oncology healthcare teams in ordering, preparing, and documenting the administration of chemotherapy. COMS is an automated tool that enables end-to-end tracking of chemotherapy regimen including pharmacy orders, order templates, provider notes, end of treatment summaries, and a database of relevant information. Clinicians can use the tool to access and query the chemotherapy-related clinical data needed to meet a variety of reporting needs. In either an outpatient or inpatient setting, the COMS application supports the unique needs of oncology healthcare teams with standardized capabilities to meet direct order entry, clinical documentation, and assessing the administration of chemotherapy.

name: Child Care Records Management System
description: The Child Care Records Management System (CCRMS) will provide the capability to apply for the Child Care Subsidy Program (CCSP) benefits online, upload supporting documentation to CCRMS, capture Child Care Provider Information, electronically verify all required information.

name: CLAIMS
description: The CLAIMS Authentication server, housed at Falling Waters, WV, is critical to the functioning of the Compensation and Pension Record Interchange (CAPRI). It supports connectivity by users from multiple program offices through the CAPRI system to all VAMCs, allowing the setup and performance of the Compensation and Pension exams, and to interface with VBA. This also provides connectivity for the Suicide Hotline/Veterans Crisis Line (VCL), a critical service provided by VHA. It is also used by other applications critical to Veteran care (e.g. Vista Remote Access Management (VRAM), Joint Legacy Viewer (JLV), VistAWeb, and Web VRAM).

name: Claims Processing & Eligibility System
description: The Health Administration Center (HAC) Claims Processing & Eligibility System (CP&E) handles the eligibility and claims payments functions for five Congressionally mandated programs:  Civilian Health and Medical Program of the VA (CHAMPVA); CHAMPVA Caregiver; Children of Women Vietnam Veterans (CWVV); Foreign Medical Program (FMP); and Spina Bifida. The primary application is CHAMPVA, which is a comprehensive health care program in which the VA shares the cost of covered health care services and supplies with eligible beneficiaries. In conjunction with CHAMPVA, Caregivers health care claims now are processed with the CHAMPVA portion of the application under a different beneficiary type of Caregiver. The CWVV Health Care Program is a health benefits program administered by VA for children with certain birth defects born to women of Vietnam Veterans. The CWVV program provides reimbursement for medical care related conditions associated with certain birth defects except Spina Bifida, which is covered under the VAÃ¢ ‚¬ „¢s Spina Bifida program. The Spina Bifida Health Care Program is a health benefits program administered by VA for Vietnam and certain Korean VeteransÃ¢ ‚¬ „¢ birth children who have been diagnosed with Spina Bifida (except Spina Bifida Occulta). Under the Spina Bifida program, comprehensive health care considered medically necessary and appropriate is covered. The FMP is a program for Veterans who live or travel overseas. Under the FMP, the VA pays the VA allowable amount only for service-connected disabilities.

name: Clinical Assessment, Reporting and Tracking
description: The mission of the VA Clinical Assessment Reporting and Tracking (CART) Program for cardiac catheterization laboratories (CART-CL) is to support a national VA reporting system, data repository, and quality improvement program for procedures performed in VA cardiac catheterization laboratories. CART-CL is intended to improve clinical care/communication, support local and national quality improvement, monitor patient safety, capture workload of cardiac catheterization lab procedures, and inform VA system evaluation to maximize operational efficiency and patient outcomes. CART-CL is a collaborative effort between the VA Patient Care Services, Office of Information and Analytics, Ischemic Heart Disease Quality Enhancement Research Initiative (IHD-QUERI), and Office of Information and Technology (OIT).

name: Clinical Case Registries
description: Clinical Case Registries (CCR) provides a local VISTA system program for population management. As of April 2016, twenty-nine populations have been made available for local champions to query for various access to care, quality and safety initiatives.  A national database exists for two of the populations – hepatitis C and HIV.  The national data are used by the HIV, Hepatitis, and Public Health Pathogens program office for the development, assessment, and improve of national policy.  The Allocation Resource Center (ARC) uses quarterly extracts of the national data for VERA modeling and other program office and VHA leadership benefit from analyses conducted in the national database for these two conditions

name: Clinical Data Repository/Health Data Repository
description: The Department of Defense (DoD) and the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in partnership, designed and implemented a Clinical Data Repository/Health Data Repository (CHDR) system that generates standards-based, computable, electronic health records that can be exchanged between the two agencies healthcare systems for patients marked as Active Dual Consumers (ADC). At DoD, medical records and patient health care histories are stored in the Clinical Data Repository (CDR), a component of the Armed Forces Health Longitudinal Technology Application (AHLTA). Similarly, the VA Health Data Repository (HDR) stores data from CHDR and the transactional clinical data from all 128 VistA applications for select clinical domains. CHDR is the link between the two repositories and once the patient is marked active ? data exchange can begin. Data exchange does not occur until ADC activation. CHDR facilitates the sharing of a Virtual Lifetime Electronic Record (VLER) between DoD and the VA for our nation's Veterans. This enables the VA/VHA to provide a comprehensive integrated medical record that is compliant with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and other privacy regulations, and to facilitate a seamless transition from military to Veteran status. CHDR works in the background to deliver improved information sharing between the DoD and VA of medical records for Active Dual Consumers (ADC) patients. The interoperability provides clinical users at DoD and VA medical facilities with bidirectional, real-time exchange of medical records that will include, at a minimum, the exchange of outpatient pharmacy and drug allergies (limited only to drug allergies) to enable drug/drug and drug/allergy order checks. The integrated clinical data between the DoD and the VA (outpatient pharmacy and drug allergy data) can be viewed in VistAWeb or CPRS Remote Data Views (RDV).

name: Clinical Product Review Committee - Enterprise Equipment Request Portal
description: The Clinical Product Review Committee - Enterprise Equipment Request (CPRC-EER) Portal provides VHA facilities with a nationally standardized online tool and processes for submitting and reviewing requests for new commodities/supplies and new equipment. The tool's data can be used to inform improvement efforts for supply chain and contracting operations.

name: Clinician User Interface
description: Per email from Project Manager on 09/25/2018, project is on hold which is expected to be temporary. It is expected to be reactivated and refunded in the future, but marked INACTIVE for now.  Clinician User Interface (CUI) improves VA’s ability to collect and process disability Rating Schedule-related information about Veterans in a computable, electronic format that can be used by other VA information systems to automate as much of the claims adjudication process as possible. CUI is an easy-to-use, web-based format, accessible from various types of devices, to speed the collection of data by internal and external medical providers. CUI allows medical providers in the community to receive requests to conduct medical exams on behalf of the VA and provide the results back to VA for Veterans who meet the requirements for the Choice Community Care Program.

name: Collaborative Terminology Tooling & Data Management
description: A standards based Clinical Terminology authoring, editing, mapping and publication tool composed of an Enterprise Terminology Tooling Server (ETTS) and a compatible Enterprise Terminology Data Management Server (ETDMS).  This system will support the work of Knowledge Based Systems (KBS) and Standards and Terminology Services (STS) in their efforts to bridge the clinical and technical domains in order to address both the Congressional and Executive mandates for interoperability, standardization, computability and meaningful use.

name: Commercial Limited Payability
description: This is a monthly process to add approximately 11,000-12,000 canceled checks per month into FMS.  Treasury has voided these checks because the checks were not cashed by the payee and the issue date exceeds 14 months.  Due to the volume, the VA cannot process these CX transactions manually into FMS.  The CLP applications formats that file to create a CX transaction that includes a header and line details for each check to be interfaced into FMS.

name: Committee on Waivers and Compromises
description: Committee on Waivers and Compromises (COWC) is a database that tracks debt waivers. It provides a tracking system for requests for waivers of debt through the Regional Office waiver process. It acts as a workload management report.

name: Common Operating Picture
description: [received notification and documentation on 08022018 from S. Waldman VASI IO that system was decommissioned and removed from all VA servers in July 10 - 16, 2018] The VA IOC Common Operating Picture (COP) provides VA Senior Leadership real-time decision support data. The on-duty VAWO retains continuous responsibility for the accuracy and integrity of COP data.

name: Common Security Employee Manager
description: The Common Security Employee Manager (CSEM) is a utility that allows a user to electronically submit a request for application or temporary access level changes. The utility actively interacts with the Common Security User Manager and the Common Security Application Manager.

name: Common Security Services
description: It is a collection of subroutines and Tuxedo application services that are used to support 32-bit Visual Basic applications, using Tuxedo/Oracle databases; Common Security Services (CSS) provides security support to the client using password encryption; managing default or regular password updates, user “lock outs,” user account inactivity, and discretionary actions. The three major components of CSS are CSUM (Common Security User Management), CSAM (Common Security Access Management), CSEM (Common Security Enterprise Management). CSUM is used to grant security access to applications and “Sensitive file” processing.

name: Common Security User Manager
description: The Common Security User Manager (CSUM) is system software and services used to control access to the corporate databases through applications utilizing Tuxedo services. Common Security Services (CSS) will provide a standard administrative service for establishing and maintaining security profiles to include permissions, applications, roles, and functions. The purpose of CSS is to validate, coordinate, monitor, and perform security application access control and restrict access to sensitive data for the corporate environment. The corporate environment is defined as the corporate Sun Solarice, and Legacy systems accessible from the corporate applications. The objective of a CSS security application is to be able to provide adequate security controls in a flexible work setting, and reduce the need for multiple solutions to control and monitor access to veteran data.

name: Community Care - Electronic Data Interchange Gateway
description: The Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Gateway (EDIGW) is part of the Community Care Provider Payment Program. It serves as a broker of electronic data transmissions between Office of Community Care systems and other entities including those internal and external to the Department of Veterans Affairs. This system performs a series of extract transfer load (ETL), data transformation, file transfer, and data archiving procedures based on business rules and documented file format standards to ensure data sets, both created and received, are compliant and are serialized in formats digestible by downstream applications.

name: Community Care Clinical and Business Intelligence Solution
description: The Enterprise Program Reporting System (EPRS) is a clinical and business intelligence tool that enables VHA OCC and VHA leadership to monitor the Veteran’s journey through community care processes, supporting contractor accountability, and informing program improvement efforts. Veterans may never interact with EPRS directly, but the system plays a major role in their community care experience. Network adequacy and the timeliness of care delivery are key priorities for Veterans and the VHA, and the data collected and reported by this system are essential for ensuring that Veterans can access timely and appropriate community care.

name: Community Care Document and Process Enabled Repositories
description: The Community Care  Document and Process Enabled Repositories (DAPER) system is used to the administer the Meds by Mail (MbM) Project in order to meet growing workload and more efficiently manage the comprehensive outpatient mail pharmacy services that provide more than 3 million medications annually to qualifying Veterans’ family members beneficiaries of the CHAMPVA program. As a MbM Pharmacy staff member processes prescriptions for Veteran’s beneficiaries (family members) under the Civilian Health and Medical Program for Veterans Affairs (CHAMPVA), the DAPER application system will optimize the handling of stored processed prescription information in a central repository and improve operational efficiencies.

name: Community Care Document Imaging
description: The Community Care Document Imaging (CCDI) solution is an intelligent forms automation solution that provides powerful data capture software capabilities. The solution enables VA to create and distribute forms, and automate form processing, using OCR and other recognition technologies, to eliminate time-consuming manual data entry. CCDI automatically captures, classifies and extracts information from paper, electronic documents and forms to create accurate, process-ready content. The CCDI front-end capture scanning applications (Teleforms) are not inclusive to the back-end VDIF-EP (HealthShare) platform.

name: Community Care Episodes
description: Standardized Episodes Of Care is a standard set of services and procedures bundled together that relate to a specific category of care or sub-specialty. Also known as Care Bundle, it is a set of services provided to treat a clinical condition or procedure. These standardized sets will be stored in an enterprise-level database, and then exposed to consumers. Designated clinical administrators will use a CRUD (Create-Read-Update-Delete) service to manage data within that database.

name: Community Care Mobile Application Development
description: Community Care is launching an effort to develop applications for veterans that can run on theirmobile devices, ie, mobile phones or tablets. These devices can operate via public wi-fi orbroadband, independent of classic physical network connections. Hence, they are moreversatile for use by veterans who may be searching for Community Care resources while outsidethe home; in their cars, in restaurants or cafes, etc. These applications will provide the wholegamut of Community Care information to veterans, such as, information on community careservices, real-time eligibility certification, insurance information, and external provider namesand addresses including scheduling functionality with them. These mobile applications will benew, or patterned after existing internet-based VA applications, and designed to operate onmobile devices. Candidates will be selected based on requirements and priorities established byCommunity Care business owners and SME’s.

name: Community Care Referral Documentation
description: The Referral Documentation (REFDOC) project expands availability of a web-based application that extends a valuable new service to veterans. This application is currently hosted in Region 1, with deployment to a limited population. This project will expand availability to a national audience. The tool was originally developed by the Atlanta VAMC and upgraded to a web-based application by the Portland Innovation Center, to assist Non-VA Care Coordination (NVCC) staff with producing documents in support of the Community Care and Veterans Choice Programs (VCP). The tool provides end-users, i.e., VHA medical, clinical and admin staff, with the ability to generate electronically a consolidated PDF file that contains information relevant to the Veteran’s community-care appointment such as patient demographics, Choice authorization (VHA Form 10-0386), consult, progress notes, medication list, lab work, and imaging results. To provide external Community Care Program providers timely information on veterans entrusted to their care, this system automates and digitizes a manual process for extracting this information from at least five different hard-copy (printed) sources. Pulling data directly from VA databases, this application populates and generates single PDF file with all of this information. It features a web-based interface for access from anywhere. It is currently in use on a regional basis. This project will elevate it to national deployment as a Class 1 application. This project transitions the platform from a regional server to a world-class hosting EO (EWIS) environment that has the resources and infrastructure to ensure high availability, performance, security, disaster/recovery and timely and effective maintenance. The new hosting platform will provide virtual servers for development, testing, staging/pre-production and production. The regional development team will continue to develop and release new functionality in iterations of monthly or quarterly sprints, until alternate arrangements are made at the national level.

name: Community Care Reimbursement System
description: The CCRS Project will create a highly automated system to be used in support of the new Community Care Network to align with industry standard claim reimbursements to fully automate and integrate with other business systems including Referral and Authorization, Revenue, Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA), data analytics and financial systems. Required changes are essential to realize the future state Community Care model, including a highly integrated and automated system supporting both contracted Community Care Networks.

name: Community Viewer
description: Community Viewer (CV) is a browser based software application that facilitates the secureexchange of data between Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) systems and non VA providers,known as Community Care Providers (CCPs). The exchange of data improves the coordination ofcare and continuity of care for VA patients receiving treatment outside of the VA network. CVpulls information from VA health care systems in real time for viewing within a web browser.Through CV, VA Administrative Staff (VAS) assign patients to CCPs and provision CCP use withinthe CV system, allowing CCPs access to view consolidated patient data from multiple VeteransInformation Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) systems.NOTE: TheÂ JLV/CVÂ project encompasses JLV and CV which are both read-only, web-based applications that support clinical decisions in providing care to Veterans. This project will provide both VA clinicians and community providers with the ability to view health data necessary to make the proper clinical decisions concerning Veteran healthcare.

name: Compensation and Pension Mini-Master File
description: The Compensation and Pension Mini-Master File (CNP) is a Statistical Analysis Software (SAS) dataset that is produced on the VA Austin Information Technology Center (AITC) mainframe and consists of selected fields from the Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA) Compensation & Pension (C&P) Master File maintained at the VA Hines Information Technology Center (HITC). The C&P Master File contains data related to distribution of benefits and is sourced from the legacy VBA Benefits Delivery Network (BDN) Compensation and Pension system. Note that the VBA is in the process of replacing the legacy BDN Compensation and Pension system with the corporate VETSNET database utilizing phased migration of data from the legacy BDN system to the corporate VETSNET system. Once data migration has been completed, the CNP SAS dataset on the VA AITC mainframe will no longer be available. The projected time frame for migration completion is Fall 2012.  The data is created at the VA HITC and is transmitted to the VA AITC bi-monthly. A copy of the transmitted file is made and formatted into the SAS CNP dataset. The files are maintained by VBA personnel and updated twice a month. The CNP SAS dataset contains 300 characters of data extracted from the C&P Master File and is widely used by Hines for recurring and onetime extracts.  There are two kinds of master records in the C&P Master File and in the CNP SAS dataset:  Type A Veteran's Master Record and Type B Death Payee. As of May 21, 2012 there were 3,494 type A Master Records and 2,656 type B records left to convert.

name: Compensation and Pension Record Interchange
description: Compensation & Pension Record Interchange (CAPRI) is a Graphic User Interface (GUI) for VISTA Automated Medical Information Exchange (AMIE II) menu options. Compensation and Pension Record Interchange (CAPRI) supports Compensation and Pension exam information. The CAPRI software acts as a bridge between VBA and VHA information systems. It offers VBA Rating Specialists help in building the rating decision documentation through online access to medical data.  It offers extensive reporting functionality to aid CS & PFS in the administration of veterans' CS & PFS benefits. It also offers access to VistA Web as well as DoD data available via FHIE/BHIE. VHA is also a customer of CAPRI, but VHA and VBA have different application needs due to the differing nature of their duties.

name: Compensation and Pension Web Application
description: [Per C. Holt at the 10-23-2018 VTWG, system is now inactive. Retirement CO: CO513544FY19] was provided. C&P Web Applications ensure that veterans' medical records are properly handled and distributed to the proper organizations to complete the requested transaction.  CWA is an application that is part of ebenefits.

name: Computer Assisted Payment Processing System
description: The CAPPS system is used by FMS to match invoices to receiving reports and thereby generate payment transactions. It maintains a bi-directional interface with FMS.List of DLN's generated by IFCAP from receiving reports transmitted to FMS. This interface file stores DLN’s that is filter from the FMS daily batch file received from VistA (IFCAP). The FMS interface is a real time lookup for the DLN on receiving reports and payment transactions to validate that duplicate receiving reports do not interfaced into FMS nor duplicate payments are issued.  The DLN generated by IFCAP for receiving reports is the key indicator and the only field within this interface file.  Before replacing CAPPS this interface functionality included invoice DLN's from invoices transmitted to CAPPS and other invoices processed by FSC legacy systems replaced by IPPS. However, the FMS invoice duplicate two-way lookup is no longer working properly. There is a FMS Service Request to correct the payment two-way lookup for invoice DLN’s without using CAPPS connections as our interest is to remove CAPPS from the shelf. CAPPS is in a hybrid state and it’s payment processing functions have been taken over by IPPS, but CAPPS continues to download, pre-process and submit RT documents to FMS via PFMSZIF7.CAPPS online applications will be required for some time, even in archive mode because FMS continues to execute a real-time access to the IDMS CV89 records.

name: Conference Oversight and Reporting Knowledgebase
description: The Conference Oversight and Reporting Knowledgebase (CORK) II application serves as the VA’s repository for reportable conference events as defined in VA Financial Policies and Procedures, Conference Planning, Reporting and Oversight, Volume XIV, Chapter 10. The CORK application is used to generate reports that provide the public with information on reportable VA conferences, as well as quarterly reports to Congress and annual reports to the VA Office of the Inspector General (OIG).

name: Consolidated Billing Statement System
description: The Consolidated Billing Statement System (CBSS) provides a single, consolidated patient statement, self-service options for payment, and other modifications, which will allow the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to apply payments made by Veterans to the appropriate account.

name: Consolidated Copayment Processing Center System
description: The Consolidated Copayment Processing Center (CCPC) System contains Veteran patient contact and billing information in order to support the printing and mailing of patient billing statements. The CCPC Lockbox system is designed to handle first-party medical debt billing information. First-party billing is defined as a patient debt for which the patient is responsible for payment (normally co-payment) for health care treatment. This differs from third-party billing where a third party (e.g., insurance company, Health Maintenance Organization (HMO)) is primarily responsible for repaying the VA. CCPC does not handle third-party billing information. The Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture Accounts Receivable (AR) module collects information for CCPC at every Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC). A daily batch process is used to collect and transmit the information to the VA Austin Information Technology Center. All collected patient and billing information is kept active on CCPC for a period of one month. A master list containing six months activity is archived for reference should historical information be needed. The users of this database include the VAMCs, Veterans Health Administration Chief Business Office, and the patients who receive billing statements.

name: Consult Toolbox
description: First, it makes it very easy for staff to document actions completed quickly and consistently. Second, it uses consistent verbiage to document these steps. Third, it eliminates the need to take a second action or make a separate entry to track scheduling steps. Fourth, this consistent verbiage allows software analysis of records without needing to have software changes to VistA or CPRS.

name: Control of Veterans Records System
description: COVERS is a Microsoft Windows-based Client/Server application using barcode technology to support RO (Regional Office) and RMC (Record Management Center) folder activities, including requests, mail, search, and external transfers. The primary function of COVERS is tracking the location of folders within, and between offices.  COVERS track the file number, name, power of attorney, and current location of each folder.  The effective functioning of COVERS requires that the database accurately reflect the actual current physical location of the folder. COVERS is designed as a 'receipt-based' system.  This means that the COVERS database is updated each time a folder is received at a location.  For example, if a folder is moved from the 'Files' location to the 'Adjudication' location, Adjudication will issue a COVERS 'Receive' transaction as soon as possible to update the database.

name: Converged Registries Solution
description: To support Veterans Health Administration (VHA) in delivering congressional and presidential mandated registries, this solution is being developed based on a centralized relational database collecting data from authoritative data sources.  The Converged Registries Solution Enhancements (CRSe) project provides a web portal to enable one entry point for all registries. The system will provide a back end data base with a subset for each registry that includes common data and then registry specific data.

name: Converged Registries Solution Enhancements
description: [INACTIVE: CRSe was intended to be an enhancement of CRS (1146): Converged Registries Solution (CRS) but was never moved to Production; Enhancement now called Veterans Integrated Registries Platform (VIRP)]  Converged Registries Solution Enhancements (CRSe) provides a web portal to enable one entry point for all registries.  The system will provide a back end data base with a subset for each registry that includes common data and then registry specific data.

name: Cooperative Studies Program
description: CSP Clinical Research Pharmacy located in Albuquerque, NM. The center supports several dozen clinical trials throughout the US and several foreign countries.

name: Corporate Data Warehouse
description: The Veterans Health Administration (VHA) is increasingly dependent upon data.  To improve our capacity to leverage data and analysis to provide the most efficient and the highest quality health care to our Veteran patients, VHA is pursuing an enterprise-wide approach that views certain key data as a strategic asset. Central to this strategy is consolidating data from disparate sources into a coherent single logical data model. The Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) is the physical implementation of this logical data model at the enterprise level for VHA. This is a data warehouse for VistA reporting, with no direct connection to FMS. Stores information from IFCAP/GIP, AEMS/MERS, MAXIMO, and item and vendor files. Used for national reporting purposes.

name: Corporate Database
description: Central database to which data from BDN and various other legacy databases is being transitioned after conversion. It currently supports VETSNET C&amp;P and various other applications. It will be supporting VBMS C&amp;P planned in future to replace VETSNET C&amp;P. Corp Database is highly normalized (Oracle 10g) relational database. It is an integrated Enterprise database that supports multiple VBA business lines and applications that include C&amp;P, Education, VR&amp;E, and LGY. Considerable amount of C&amp;P BDN legacy data has been converted into Corp databases. About 99% of C&amp;P Master Records have been converted over from BDN to the Corp DB as of July 2011 (as per OBPI). (At the time of C&amp;P Master record conversion, the corporate database contains a system of tables that store the data in a very similar structure as it appears in the C&amp;P master, for historical purposes only. This data is never changed. The data is also stored in the corporate database, which is highly normalized, and does not have a similar structure to the BDN Master, and that data is maintained. However, no data is lost, so the actual data from the C&amp;P master is stored, even though the structure of that data is different). Several Education services databases/applications outside BDN have been also converted into Corp database and re-designed and built in J2EE platform. CWINRS is also part of Corp database. Corp database promotes common data sharing among multiple benefit applications and maintains the veterans data integrity on a single platform. It supports both legacy Tuxedo-based client/server applications such as VETSNET, and current J2EE Web-based, or SOA applications such as WEAMS, WSMS, FOCAS, and VONAPP II. In Corp database, one single CORP schema holds all the data. This is a Corp common schema account. However, each application for VETSNET, for VR&amp;E, for Education, and for others is having its own database accounts. Those application accounts usually don't own the data but may have its application specific programs. All these accounts will have its specific CRUD privileges on the data owned by the Corp schema account.

name: Corporate WINRS
description: Vocational Rehab and Educational Program (VRE). Tracks Services for Disabled Vets. VRE Corporate WINRS Case Management Application is the same as CWINRS, Corp WINRS, Corporate WINRS, and sometimes even WINRS. CorporateWINRS (CWINRS) application provides VRE counselors with a case management toolset.This is an electronic case management system that supports vocational rehabilitation and counseling services to disabled veterans (Chapter 31 benefits).
