This is a VBA system that maintains a bi-directional interface with FMS in order to make payments for individuals that are eligible under this program.Sends a payment file to FMS. Retrieves vendor update records from FMS. Retrieves Treasury reconciliations from FMS.

name: Courseware Delivery System
description: The Courseware Delivery System (CDS), owned by the VBA Employee Development and Training office, is a web-based application that supports VBA training initiatives. CDS provides uniform and consistent training to employees in all VA Regional Offices, in order to improve Veterans' claims processing. CDS is used by all seven of VBA’s business lines.

name: COVERS Sequence Check
description: This application allows for the scanning of folders into COVERS. It is normally used to re-confirm all the Claim, NOD and Temp folders at a location. Stakeholder listed Business Sponsor as OBPI.

name: CPAC Revenue Workflow Tools
description: There are five key workflow tools within the Consolidated Patient Account Center Revenue Workflow Tools (CPAC RWT) provided by the Huron and MdClarityTeams: 1) TRAC® 2) ONTRAC® 3) First Party 4) Enterprise Denials 5) Payer Compliance Tool. These workflow tools provide daily work drivers for staff and daily/weekly reporting for management within the CPAC. The tools receive nightly extracts from a variety of sources: All five tools receive nightly extracts from each of the individual VistA databases Enterprise Denials and Payer Compliance receive nightly extracts of the 835s from the Austin FSC as well as a nightly extract from the TRAC Databases. The TRAC tool receives a nightly extract from the Payer Compliance tool. All of the data is stored behind the VA firewall on sites and servers managed by CPAC IT. Currently, they are physically located at the Mid-Atlantic CPAC in Asheville, NC with a back-up location at the Mid-South CPAC in Smyrna, TN.

name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Lookback Dataset
description: Tracking system for patients identified in the CJD lookback notification initiative.

name: Customer Relationship Management
description: The application is a customer relationship management (CRM) application that will be used to support operational customer service inquiries for VA FSC customers. All incoming customer inquiries will be captured in CRM as a service item (often referred to as a case) to track the customer information for the individual requesting support, reason for the inquiry, and resolution of the inquiry. Managers will then be able to run reports that reflect the volume of inquiries, categories of inquiries and details around timeframe to resolve inquiries to ensure we are meeting customer service level agreements (SLAs). The customer support will be focused on two primary areas – VA Station calls needing support for financial transactions and invoice processing related questions and calls related to local payroll inquiries.

name: Data Access Services
description: Data Access Services (DAS) is a system of middleware applications that is responsible for the transport of the Veterans health, benefits, or administrative data between consumers and producers. DAS provides a common access mechanism for Veterans’ electronic record information stored in and outside of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA).

name: Data Architecture Repository
description: A portal to a central location to find information about VA metadata and other VA related documentation. DAR shows (1) what kind of data VA has available (2) how the data elements are related (3) where the data resides.

name: Data Management Interface
description: Interface engine that moves data between VHA VistA applications and mainframe applications running at the AITC.

name: Data Translation
description: Translation service provided to VHA to translate incoming data from one format.

name: Debt Management Center - Front End Scanning
description: DMC-FES is a Document Management System that allows users to View, Index and Route Documents submitted by Veterans to be worked in specific queues. DMC is transitioning from a paper to electronic document management system.

name: Debt Management System
description: This system manages file transmissions from the VA Medical Centers of VHA first party referral debts to the VBA Debt Management Center for debt collection activities.

name: Dialysis National Contract
description: The Dialysis National Contract (DNC) System supports a national VA contract for dialysis care. The DNC system includes dialysis and reclaim providing veteran authorization and eligibility information for dialysis claims payments processed by PCS. The DNC system services all 21 VISNs under national provider contracts using Medicare guidelines and rates. DNC is built with the Plexis Claims Management (PCM) COTS application. Plexis is used as the Claim Adjudication Engine. The DNC system uses 3M Grouper Plus System (GPS) pricing software providing current Medicare claim calculations and edits ensuring that the most advantageous reimbursement methodology is applied. Providers access the Provider Portal via the internet through the VA gateways and across the VA Wide Area Network (WAN) to the FSC firewall. This portal resides in the FSC DMZ and accesses required information from an internal database behind the FSC firewall. VA users access the system via the VA Intranet. All WAN connectivity is Multiprotocol label switching (MPLS) and managed by the VA National Security Operations Center (NSOC). All application traffic is Ethernet and managed by the VA FSC.

name: Diffusion Marketplace for Health Care System Knowledge
description: The DM will provide a collaboration platform of best practices (information management system), which provides a searchable engine, and includes the resources to implement practices on a National level. The DM will also focus on distributing information on a centralized information system while providing an amazing user friendly experience. That allows best practices to be shared and discovered throughout the VA to get diffused or implemented faster. These are proven practices that save lives, save money, improve healthcare outcomes, and improve veteran satisfaction.

name: Direct Secure Messaging
description: DSM allows for the sharing of medical information between the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and non-VA care providers.  DSM permits the electronic exchange of information over the Internet using the Direct Project standards published by Health and Human Services, the Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT.

name: Eastern Pacemaker Surveillance Center Database
description: The Eastern Pacemaker Surveillance Center Database supports the Eastern Pacemaker Surveillance Center (EPSC) staff in its function of monitoring some 11,000 Veterans Health Administration (VHA) patients who have implanted pacemakers or cardioverters.

name: eBenefits Web Portal
description: The eBenefits Web Portal (EBN) is designed for Wounded Warriors, Veterans, Service members, their families, and those who care for them.  EBN provides two main services. It's a catalog of links to information on other websites about military and Veteran benefits. And it provides a personalized workspace called My eBenefits which gives quick access to all the online tools now integrated into eBenefits - tools allows veterans to apply for benefits, download their DD 214, and see their benefits status online. Service members, Veterans, and family members can register for EBN, which affords access to the secure features in My eBenefits and allows the portal to be personalized to the user's needs.

name: Electronic Computer Access Request
description: Electronic Computer Access Request, Access Auditing &amp;amp; Review System for Intra &amp;amp; Inter-Facility Computer Access. Clearance of personnel and timely account terminationAutomated access control for inactive accountsLeast privilege / role based access complianceCompliance with access control change management in response to employee movement (transfers, clearance, termination)

name: Electronic Data Interchange Web Viewer
description: Provides a graphical user interface to the EDI claims that are being processed (Minor Application)

name: Electronic Insurance
description: The Insurance website is housed at the Philadelphia ITC and acts as an entry point to VA Life Insurance Self Service web applications. There are three components that are part of the Insurance Self-Service System, Online Policy Access (OPA), Unclaimed Funds Search (UFN) and Service-Disabled Veterans Insurance (S-DVI). OPA allows users to view their insurance policy information and documents, request a policy loan or dividend withdrawal. It is integrated with Identity Access Management’s Access VA service to provide Level 2 authentication to users who wish view their policy information online. UFN allows the general public to search a database of unclaimed funds by name, social security number or other identifying data to see if Insurance might be holding a returned check or other unclaimed liability. S-DVI allows veterans with a rating for a new disability to apply for Service Disabled Veterans Insurance online. Applicants can submit their applications electronically or print and mail their completed application. The on-line form uses turbo-tax type questions to help determine eligibility. Its data output creates the VICTARS record for immediate processing.

name: Electronic Insurance Verification
description: The Insurance Verification uses computer communications to ask about health care eligibility and benefits of the commercial and Blues payers. Inquiries source from VistA systems to furnish current coverage information for insured and previously considered uninsured veterans. Increased accuracy and currency of verified insurance reduces the number of rejected third party claims. The billing opportunities are increased by the identification of insurance.

name: Eligibility Office Automation System
description: The Memorials Eligibility Office Automation (EOA) application will manage  case management processing through a Graphical User Interface (GUI), improve reporting, and t will enable the Eligibility Office (EO) staff to accurately generate eligibility documents.  Capability will allow  manually entered PreNeed cases to be processed, summarized in reports, included in case management, and integrated with Time of Need processing.

name: Embedded Fragments Registry
description: A critical component of the TEFSC medical surveillance program is the development of an Embedded Fragment Registry. This registry provides a mechanism to identify Veterans with embedded fragments, manage clinical data related to embedded fragments, and develop medical and surgical guidelines that will enable the TEFSC staff and VA clinicians to deliver appropriate medical care to these Veterans.

name: Emergency Department Integration System
description: The Emergency Department Integration System (EDIS) is a VHA-wide application used to track and manage the delivery of care to patients in the Emergency Care System (ECS).  This critical IT solution directly supports the Major Initiative ""Enhance the Veteran Experience and Access to Healthcare (EVEAH).  EDIS v1.0 is currently being deployed in each VHA hospital and is scheduled for deployment completion by 7/31/2011.  The application improves emergency department care by introducing the systematic collection, display and reporting on patient status information.  It is able to integrate with Appointment Management and Patient Care Encounter within VistA.  EDIS v2.0 is currently being planned and will provide enhancements, better functionality and improved reports.

name: Emerging Pathogens Initiative
description: Assists in tracking infectious diseases.  It establishes a SAS data set which is used by the Office of Infectious Diseases (OID).

name: Enrollment Certification Automated Processing
description: Electronic Certification Automated Processor is a system that receives certifications of enrollments and changes in certifications of enrollments from schools via VA ONCE.  ECAP automatically processes a number of these certifications in BDN without human intervention.  ECAP establishes end products for certifications that cannot be completed without human intervention.   The Hines staff is currently modernizing ECAP.  ECAP is maintained at Hines. ECAP uses a dedicated server and PCs to electronically process enrollment certifications and notices of change in student status received from schools using VA-Once, the VA Online Certification of Enrollment.  ECAP tries to identify the education benefit, establish pending issues, and process education awards through to authorization. ECAP currently processes chapter 30 re-enrollment certifications and notices of change in student status.

name: Enrollment Database
description: Income Verification Matching (IVM), also referred to as Enrollment Database System (EDB), is a web based application that is accessed by Income Verification Division (IVD) staff at Health Eligibility Center (HEC) under the Veterans Benefit Administration (VBA). IVD uses the IVM solution to support its mission of collecting and verifying Veterans income information to determine eligibility for medical care from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). Annual means tests involve matching household income information for non-compensable 0% service-connected and non-service-connected Veterans without special eligibility against their income records maintained by the Internal Revenue Service and the Social Security Administration.

name: Enrollment System Redesign
description: Enrollment System Redesign (ESR) defines health benefit plans for which a client (Veteran, Service member, and beneficiary) is eligible and ties them to the authority for care. Eligibility is derived from Client enrollment applications, Military Service Information, rating decisions, financial information, and other factors. Supports the management of enrollment correspondence and telephone inquiries; shares eligibility and enrollment information with other Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and non-VA (e.g., Department of Defense) organizations; and supports national reporting and analysis of VHA Enrollment data.  Provides a simplified description to authorized clients, providers, partners, and affiliations of the health benefits available to a client. For example; Medical Benefits, Dental benefits, Housing, Prescriptions, etc. Provides self-service opportunities for Clients which allows them to save, submit and edit health benefit application information online.

name: Enterprise Data Warehouse
description: The Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) is a component of the VBA VD2 application, and is resident in  an Oracle M5-32 server located at AITC. The EDW was established to maintain a centralized view of the Veterans Benefits Administration's activities and centralized storage and access to the data needed to perform those activities. EDW ensures a consistent representation of stored information that is identified and shared among applications to establish a more efficient and consistent approach to facilitating communication between business users. The major technical advantage of the EDW is the use of a relational database that eliminates data redundancy.

name: Enterprise Risk Registry
description: Web-based enterprise risk registry system to track and manage enterprise risks.

name: Enterprise Services Collaboration Portal
description: The Enterprise Services Collaboration Portal (ESCP) provides the VA IT service consumer (e.g. application software developers, COTS/GOTS integration teams, etc.) and Enterprise Service provider organizations a one-stop access point to promote, search, view, collaborate and request access to authoritative data and essential Enterprise Services (ES). The ESCP will not create another review board or management body, but will work with the current authorities in a collaborative partnership to foster the development of new services and innovative processes from strategic and tactical planning through service retirement in support of the Veteran. This enterprise platform will be available to all VA application development teams consuming shared services and Shared Service Providers.

name: Enterprise Testing Service VMWare Database
description: Deliver to TSEI customers a highly scalable, secure and innovative service that allows organizations to seamlessly migrate and extend their on-premises VMware vSphere-based environments to the AWS Cloud. This will provide customer access to all geographic locations and enhance TSEI onpremises services. This will allow TSEI customers access to respective databases for integral testing of applications. Also provides a standard repository for the databases and access in the event of a Test Center outage or unavailability.

name: Enterprise Veterans Self Service
description: An application that is accessible through both the internet and VA Wide-Access Network (WAN).  It is a VA/DOD portal that serves up benefit information from both agencies.  The President's Commission on Care for America's Returning Wounded Warriors (Dole/Shalala) established by Executive Order 13426 in March 2007 recommended the creation of a My eBenefits (a.k.a. eBenefits) web portal to provide the wounded, injured and ill service members/Veterans, their families and care providers a single sign-on, central access point to online benefits and related services. The eBenefits portal is a one-stop shop for benefits-related online tools and information. The portal is designed for Wounded Warriors, Veterans, Service members, their families, and those who care for them. eBenefits provides two main services. It's a catalog of links to information on other websites about military and Veteran benefits. And it provides a personalized workspace called My eBenefits which gives quick access to all the online tools now integrated into eBenefits - tools that let you do things like apply for benefits, download your DD 214, and see your benefits status online. Service members, Veterans, and family members can register for eBenefits, which affords access to the secure features in My eBenefits and allows the portal to personalized to the user's needs. You must be enrolled in the Defense Enrollment Eligibility Reporting System (DEERS) to create an account. The EVSS is a portal platform that supports interactions between VA and Veterans through the streamlining of access to self service capabilities, and improvements to the processes used to identify and grant access to the VA's Veterans and Dependents (Members) and those providing services on behalf of the Veteran (Providers).

name: Environmental Agents Service Registries
description: The Registry is maintained to enable the VA to keep Veterans informed on research findings or new compensation policies through periodic newsletters. It provides a mechanism to catalogue prominent symptoms, reproductive health, reported exposures and diagnoses, and to communicate with Veterans. The voluntary, self-selected nature of the registry makes it valuable for health surveillance; however, it is not designed or intended to be a research tool and therefore, the results cannot be generalized to represent all Veterans illnesses resulting from service in a theatre of conflict. Please see individual Monograph entries for specific details on:  Ionizing Radiation Registry (IRR), Agent Orange Registry (AOR), and the Gulf War Registry (GWR).

name: Environmental Epidemiology Service Registry
description: Receives a roster of social security numbers for recently-discharged Veterans who served during the Persian Gulf Era from the DOD on a quarterly basis.

name: EO Cloud
description: [9/1/16 - Per RVWG on 8/25/16, this system will be decommissioned.] VA Enterprise Operations cloud model provides a secure, on-demand network access to a shared pool of configurable computing resources that can be rapidly provisioned with minimal management effort or service provider interaction for Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) multi-tenancy cloud subscribers.  Service model offered includes: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) (and Platform as a Service (PaaS). The cloud implementation is based primarily on VMware's vCloud Director software.   Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS):The capability provided to the consumer is to provision processing, storage, networks, and other fundamental computing resources where the consumer is able to deploy and run arbitrary software, which can include operating systems and applications. The consumer does not manage or control the underlying cloud infrastructure but has control over operating systems, storage, and deployed applications; and possibly limited control of select networking components. This environment will also be referred to as a Hosting Only environment.   Platform as a Service (PaaS): The capability provided to the consumer is to deploy onto the cloud infrastructure consumer-created or acquired applications created using programming languages, libraries, services, tools, and resources supported by the provider. The consumer does not manage or control the underlying cloud infrastructure including network, servers, operating systems, or storage, but has control over the deployed applications and possibly configuration settings for the application-hosting environment. This environment will also be referred to as Shared Hosting and Managed Hosting environment.

name: Equipment Lease Management Service
description: The purpose of this Equipment Lease Management Service (ELMS) is to track equipment Leases. VA uses ELMS to enter accounting data, general information, and supporting documentation for all VA equipment leases. ELMS users will be able to add new leases, edit, archive leases, as well as, search and generate reports.

name: eScreening
description: eScreening is a software system developed by Center of Excellence for Stress and Mental Health (CESAMH) in conjunction with the VA Center for Innovation. eScreening allows Veterans to use tablets to report health symptoms in a VA clinic. The system has 2-way VistA/CPRS communication which assigns needed health screens and submits the information to CPRS to satisfy clinical reminders and generate a clinical note for review and signature. eScreening allows real-time scoring of screens for staff notification of high-risk veterans for same-day care, and generates a personalized feedback sheet for the Veteran. Dynamic progress reporting allows staff and Veterans to monitor health symptoms over-time. A robust forms editor allows the system to be flexible to fit any clinic, as it can edit nearly every aspect of the system. eScreening can harness the power of technology to improve the Veteran's experiences in VHA clinics and allow clinicians to practice at the top of their license. System is currently running virtually in 5 locations (ADD HERE) and the intent is to expand Nationally.

name: Ethics Consultation Web
description: ECWeb is a Web-based database tool that reinforces sound ethics consultation practices and provides a consistent electronic method for documenting, storing, retrieving and evaluating ethics consultation data.

name: Events Management Analytics Platform
description: The Events Management Analytics Platform assists the VHA Employee Education System (EES) – Events Division with updating required reports and forms to comply with congressional guidelines. The system is necessary to provide assistance with the daily workload and preservation of Face to Face events within the events division. The system renders Conference Packages (CPs) straight out of the system, as well as congressional reporting forms (10089B and 10089A). It also provides document storage for the documents to be stored in case of a possible third party audit.

name: Explanation of Benefits and Payments, Healthcare Resolution Application
description: An automated method for receipt and tracking of claim payments and associated data within the Department of Veterans Affairs. It is a web-based archival repository and research tool that allows the user to search for missing EEOBs that are not received due to incorrect routing information. EPHRA also allows the Austin FSC 224-unit staff to route unroutable EEOB data.

name: External Assessment Service Portal
description: EAS is a custom application developed for the Cybersecurity Operations Center (CSOC) Enterprise Network Defense (END) team to facilitate the request, initiation, completion, and reporting process for Web Application Security Assessments, Mobile Application Security Assessments, and Penetration testing.

name: Eye Injury Data Store
description: The Eye Injury Data Store (EIDS), formerly Defense and Veterans Eye Injury Registry (DVEIR), is the initiative to meet the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008, Section 1623 directive to the DoD. Another requirement mandated by this Act is to create a Vision Center of Excellence (VCE) in Prevention, Diagnosis, Mitigation, Treatment, and Rehabilitation of Military Eye Injuries with the objective to improve preventative measures and treatment of Service Members/Vets.

name: Federal Computer Assisted Payment Processing
description: This system is used to automate accounting data entry for federal purchases. FEDCAP maintains a bi-directional interface with FMS.FEDCAP was used to do matching of receivers to charges for goods purchased from GSA. It interfaced transactions to record the charges in FMS. VA staff now use a GSA web application to complete this activity.FEDCAP does not create any input to FMS; however, it’s functionality was not replaced by IPPS. The FSC has another manner in which FED payments are submitted to FMS, by direct access to a GSA server.FEDCAP will be required for some time, even in archive mode because FMS continues to execute a real-time access to the IDMS CV89 records.

name: Federal Health Information Exchange
description: The Federal Health Information Exchange (FHIE) Program is an interagency information technology initiative between the Departments of Veterans Affairs (VA) and Defense (DoD) that enables a secure, one-way transmission of protected electronic health information from DoD to VA. FHIE offers authorized VA clinicians, including those involved in claims adjudication, immediate access to DoD clinical data about service members who separate from the Armed Forces. FHIE supports DoD's and VA's goal of ensuring a smooth transition for Veterans from active military service to civilian life. See also Bidirectional Health Information Exchange (BHIE) Initiative.

name: Fee Payment Processing System
description: The Fee Basis Payment and Processing System (FPPS) provides claim data to all VA sites allowing them to process claims electronically whereas it would be a paper based process. The system is operated by the Chief Business Office Purchased Care (CBOPC) Austin Information Technology Center (AITC) Office of Information and Technology (OIT). The system supports the population of over 9 million veterans; however, contains information on health care claims for approximately 4 million. The system is operated out of OIT Region 6 and supports all medical centers across the country. It centrally receives electronic health care data from a contracted clearing house (HIPAA Compliant 837s), forwards claim data to 150+ VA Fee Processing Sites and collects payment record data from those sites to create electronic payment remittances (HIPAA Compliant 835). Remittances are then forwarded to the contracted clearinghouse. The system supports the entire VA's ability to pay health care claims electronically.

name: Filipino Veterans Equity Compensation
description: System user interface where authorized users in the VBA Manila Regional Office review and issue final approval of beneficiary awards. Manila RO users also use the system to view information about any checks that were returned and to indicate if the check should be reissued or returned to the appropriation. Records transactions (NC) for payments (which are sent directly to Treasury) to maintain obligation balances.

name: Finance and Accounting System
description: FAS is an online financial and accounting application that provides fiscal and accounting transaction processing.  It includes an interface with Treasury for Chapter 18 Birth Defect benefit payments.  This application integrates with CSS, SHARE, SPP, MAP-D, Awards, RBA and SOC, and supports both the information gathering and budgetary requirements for the Compensation and Pension Program.  FAS is initially supporting the financial business functionality of the C&P system.  It meets the Core Financial System Requirements outlined in the Federal Financial Management System Requirements publication (FFMSR-1) authored by the Joint Financial Management Improvement Program (JFMIP).  FAS is being built so that it can be used by other VBA benefit programs, thus providing a single system which is fully compliant with current accounting requirements.  In addition to the current BDN functionality, FAS provides the ability to perform on-line transaction processing and on-line audit functions, and has automated manual review processes such as Check Verification, Fiscal Adjustments (FISA), Review of account with prior Waiver or Write Off adjustments. The system interfaces daily with the Financial Management System, allows for a systematic review of client accounts, provides a business transaction boundary, and performs daily payment processing. This system provides compliance with the U S Standard General Ledger, 24 x 7 processing, graphical user interface for the finance users, and web-enabled reports.

name: Financial Accounting Service Payment and Collection System
description: Provides ability to automate the processing of Intra-governmental Payment and Collection (IPAC) documents.  FASPAC provides an efficient and audit friendly method of collecting receivables and disbursing obligations.  FASPAC was developed in an effort to eliminate duplicate efforts by both field personnel and FSC FAS staff.  Using FASPAC also reduces the amount of paperwork flowing through fax machines and the postal system.  FASPAC will allow users to enter IPAC billing and collection requests on the Internet using the same request form that is currently in use.This system allows field sites to web encode Intra-Governmental financial data for online processing, rather than relying on the FSC for manual input. The FSC downloads data entered via FASPAC into the Treasury IPAC (Intra-Governmental Payment and Collection) Web based application, and interfaces transaction data into FMS through FSCs’ SQL server as part of a nightly process. It is one of the many FSC systems that interact with FMS through the bi-directional “PC Interfaces”.Users input data into FASCPAC and download data from Treasury's IPAC system, this information then sent to FMS to post accounting transactions.

name: Financial Content Management
description: The VAs Financial Content Management (FCM) application support several VA mainframe applications (Personnel and Accounting Integrated Data System (PAID), Financial Management System (FMS), and Central Fee (FEE)) with online report storage, indexing, archive, retrieval, management, and secure presentment. The VA programs which use FCM to process data for services include human resources, payroll, financial, and medical.

name: Financial Management System
description: The Financial Management System (FMS), VA's Corporate accounting system, was fully implemented in VHA at the beginning of FY 1996. VA's FMS system is a standardized, VA-wide system that interfaces externally with the Department of Treasury (DoT), the General Service Administration (GSA), the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), and various commercial vendors and banks for electronic billing and payment purposes. It is VA's core financial management system that interfaces internally with the IFCAP Accounts Receivable system and other subsystems such as Integrated Billing.

name: First Notice of Death
description: The First Notice of Death (FNOD) application manages the process by which Program Support Assistants (PSAs) take actions to establish or update the Beneficiary Identification and Records Locator Subsystem (BIRLS) record upon death of a Veteran or of a Veteran's Spouse (and automatically cancel benefits being provided).

name: First Party Lockbox
description: Lockbox(LBX) is a first party debt collection system for the centralized collection of payments at a bank and Pay.Gov and reconciles the necessary steps to apply the funds to a patient’s account at the VA Medical Centers (VAMC’s).

name: Flight, On-the-job training, Correspondence, Apprenticeship System
description: VBA requires a single, consolidated web-based application to replace the existing four (4) dBase IV Chapter 30 payment systems and to provide support for processing of payments for Chapter 1606 and Chapter 1607 for FLT, OJT, COR and APP award claims. The objective for this effort is to re-host the existing Chapter 30 PC to a web-based application that will consolidate all four Chapter PC legacy databases and the Chapter1606 PC database into a single J2EE/Oracle application housed within the VBA Corporate Environment. Contractors PSI, its prime partner, DV United, are in the process of designing and developing the FOCAS application which is to provide functionality that will allow processing of OOS awards for Chapter 30, Chapter 1606 and Chapter 1607 and interfacing with BDN for automated transmission of payment transactions for all three benefit programs. Contractors have completed the development of the PMP, FRD, SAD, Wireframes and RTM and are currently in the development phase of the project. FOCAS application architecture is being developed using Common Security Services (CSS) framework as the user authentication module, WebLogic 9.2 as the application server, JDBC connectivity and the  Corporate Database as major architecture components.

name: FLOW3 Enterprise Prosthetic Limb Workflow Management System
description: FLOW3 is a system of prosthetic limb care that creates a predictable, consistent and high-quality Veteran experience across VHA. Three inter-related computerized processes support care across the continuum (i.e. From prescription, through acquisition, fabrication, delivery, and validation) as follows: an artificial limb consult template, a consult comment tool (CCT), a web-based dashboard with custom screens for staff members' workflow management. A select VISN and the 7 Regional Amputation Centers will be cohort 1 of the implementation beginning in Q1 FY19. Upon completion of training, the training materials and system documentation will be assessed for effectiveness in getting staff to operationalize. Necessary adjustments to training will be made prior to cohort 2 (number of VISNs TBD) which should begin in Q3 FY19. Cohort 3 which is all remaining VISNs to begin Q1 FY20.

name: FMS Automated Veteran Input System
description: FMS AVIS provides a tool to VHA agents to update the Veterans information to FMS with minimal support from the Vendorizing team. Vendorizing team will be involved in the process to resolve exception, if any.Creates/modifies the information for vendorized Veterans who get FMS payments. The application creates FMS transactions for these Vendor file updates. It also receives back an update for the purpose of processing rejections.The FMS AVIS service sends veteran updates or additions to FMS for the vendor files.

name: Former Prisoner of War Statistical Tracking System
description: Provides registry of ex-POWs who received a protocol medical examination at VA facilities. Provides data for research studies. Provides data for reports to Congress and to the Advisory Committee on Former Prisoners of War. Provides data for evaluating the effectiveness of programs concerning ex-POWs as mandated by Public Law 97-37. Includes information on health care provided and compensation received by ex-POWs.

name: FORUM
description: FORUM is a standalone system that facilitates a lot of the VistA work, including patch tracking, configuration management, data gathering and analysis, etc.

name: Franchise and Trust Oversight Web
description: A financial data repository for the Enterprise Fund Office (EFO) that the EFO developed for their Trust Fund Oversight program.

name: FSC - Change Management Reporting System
description: Change Management Reporting System supports FSC configuration identification, configuration change control, configuration status accounting, and configuration auditing of non-production and production environments so that we are able to deploy the correct version of an FSC software product into the correct environment.

name: FSC - Financial Management Resources Application
description: The OFMR application maintains payroll data for all VA employees, current and separated. It has the capability to create custom reports and export to excel format.  It is used to search payroll data by SSN and VA EIN for current and separated VA employees going back to 1999 and forward. It is also used for audit purposes and serves as a repository for payroll data. We can gather historical data as needed from one application.  It is used daily by the FSC Payroll Support team.

name: FSC - Financial Operation Services Inquiries
description: FSC internal help ticketing system.

name: FSC - FOS Time Tracker
description: FTEs can add time entries. Administrator can add users, project managers can add projects, and users can add their weekly time sheets.

name: FSC - FSS Reporting Tool
description: FSS Reporting tool has been custom-developed for the VA FSC FSS (now CoS - ICARD).  Primary purpose is to set aside certain 28 distinct canned reports for non-SQL folks on team to pull summaries, totals, listing of non PII/PHI objects in a given date range.  Its key elements is that these canned reports are reusable, and consistent, user friendly, and accurate.  Staff within FSS (CoS - ICARD) are primary users as they rely on these to create IDAR, interests, and other reports.   Currently, one user uses it everyday while another one uses it 2-3 times a month to validate.

name: FSC - Group Tool
description: Allows users to input an e-mail address, Active Directory group name, or NT Logon name and view the groups associated with that AD id or e-mail address, or view individuals in an AD group.

name: FSC - Individual Development Plan
description: All Federal FSC employees use this application to track and record FSC employees Professional and Personal Development.  It is a tool to assist employees in career and personal development. Its primary purpose is to help employees reach short and long-term career goals, as well as improve current job performance. An IDP system benefits the organization by aligning employee(s) training and development efforts with its mission, goals, and objectives. Currently, it is used in the following ways:- Employees (used annually)- Input goals, skills, and request for training for the FY- Supervisors/Directors/FSC Leadership- used as a routing system to approve employees request for training- FSC Training Team-(used daily) - used as a system to track professional/personal development requests and to request funding for those requests

name: FSC - MCCF Lockbox
description: Accounting technicians within Charge Card Operations Section regularly use this application to conduct research on Veteran medical co-payments.  The application serves as a repository of Veteran supporting documentation of medial co-payments as it provides data on 1st Party Medical Co-Payments.

name: FSC - Nationwide Payroll
description: This application is used to store historical data for research purposes and  to easily locate retirement records.  Analysts on the FERCCA and NONFERCCA Teams use this application on a daily basis.  The Retirement Team use the application to conduct research, locate retirement records, and add notes to an existing record. If an original retirement record is created, a new record is added within SQL for recordkeeping purposes. For existing accounts, the edit feature is used to add status of inquiries received or locate records requested from our customer base.

name: FSC - Off Set Agency List
description: This is a list of Agencies that have debts against vendors. This is usually update by whomever assign the debt to the vendor. I can Edit , Add and Delete information on this system with verify through TOPS.

name: FSC - TeamMate
description: TeamMate Suite is comprised of several modules enables users to capture, compile, and report on all aspects of the complete audit process.  The TeamMate Suite is used on a daily basis by the auditors of the Internal Controls, Auditing and Risk Division (ICARD).  The modules include TeamRisk, Team Schedule, TeamCentral, Team TEC, and Team Electronic Working Papers (EWP).  The primary model used by ICARD is TeamMate EWP.  TeamMate EWP is a windows-based Audit Management System designed to bring efficiency and consistency to the entire audit process. The TeamMate Suite is a crucial tool for the auditors of ICARD.  It allows the auditors to document evidence to support their conclusion and efficiently manage audits.  With proper evidence to support audit conclusions FSC can have confidence in the recommendations ICARD presents to improve its internal controls.  As a result, FSC will be able to improve its processes to better serve the veterans and achieve its mission.

name: FSC - Treasury Offset Program
description: This system is to import TOPS Offset Program spreadsheet information to VIS and IPPS for vendors and VA to see offsets that has been taken against vendors.

name: FSC - VA Vendor Info Portal
description: The Nationwide Vendor File Division uses this application daily to ensure the veterans receive their claim payments to correct vendor file records.  Provides view of vendor change files that are uploaded overnight.  This application is tied to FMS.

name: FSC - Vendor Check
description: The Vendor Support team uses this application daily provide vendor information the same as in FMS: name, address, Tax Id, address, phone number and banking information.  This application is used when FMS is not available to assist the CSR to provide 1st Call Resolution.

name: FSC Financial Classes
description: It is a teacher administration tool to create training schedules, class administration for VA staff attendees, registration, stores and generates class certificate of completion.  Provides class statistics reports on training programs for management purposes.

name: FSC-Vendor Management System
description: A VMS Exception Report is generated for the Nationwide Vendor File Team when these exceptions are not allowed to process through the FMS system automatically through the nightly batch update. The exceptions come from local VA stations inputting Veterans information into the FMS AVIS system thus allows proper flow of adding/ modifying Veterans vendor files. Stations cannot make changes to vendor type, vendor name and SSN or TIN.  The FMS/ Nationwide Vendor File Division Sections use this application daily to ensure the Veterans receive their claim payments to correct vendor file record in a timely manner.

name: Functional Status and Outcome Database
description: The Functional Status and Outcome Database (FSOD) captures and tracks information about patient rehabilitative care throughout the VA. FSOD supports the entry of information from acute and sub-acute inpatient rehabilitation programs, as well as a broad range of outpatient rehabilitation programs. Outcome-based information including length of stay and cost is also tracked. Participating Veterans Affairs Medical Center staff enter information into FSOD on-line through a software program called VA FIMware (Functional Independence Measurement (FIM)). Users throughout the VA can access stored FSOD data through VA FIMware. Quarterly, FSOD data is transferred electronically to the Uniform Data System for Medical Rehabilitation (UDSmr) server in Buffalo, New York. The UDSmr database contains a U.S. national roll-up of rehabilitative programs. Users include all VA personnel involved in rehabilitative care and the UDSmr.

name: Funding Fee Payment System
description: FFPS is used to manage and accept funding fee payments from lenders on VA guaranteed loans. FFPS maintains an interface to FMS. FFPS sends summary level accounting to FMS about funding fees paid by lenders to VA that are processed through Pay.gov. FFPS also sends refunds requests that have been approved by the VA Regional Loan to FMS for payment (the payees have already been vendorized). FFPS does not interact with FMS directly. The file is place on the mainframe, and FMS processes it from there.One of three primary systems (FFPS, VALERI & WebLGY) used in the Loan Guaranty process: Funding Fee Payment System (FFPS), VA Loan Electronic Reporting Interface (VALERI), and WebLGY. FFPS handles funding fees for non-VA owned loans that come through pay.gov, and funding fee refunds from the VA to borrowers. FFPS sends summary level accounting to FMS about funding fees paid by lenders to VA that are processed through Pay.gov. FFPS also sends refunds requests that have been approved by the VA Regional Loan to FMS for payment (the payees have already been vendorized).FFPS does not interact with FMS directly. The file is placed on the mainframe, and FMS processes it from there.

name: GECDAC Data Visualization Product
description: This is a data visualization product to provide the Geriatrics & Extended Care Data & Analysis Center (GECDAC) Leaders in VHA a visual snapshot of the utilization in users and cost of geriatric program in the VA. The system was developed using R and Shiney Server, with information from CDW. This system is hosted on the VAEC and has no PHI/PII.

name: General Counsel Legal Automation Workload System
description: GCLAWS is the legal case matter tracking application developed for the VA Office of the General Counsel (OGC).      Backend Database built on SQL Server 2005, SP2.  Front-end is a custom Windows application built with Borland Delphi.   A GUI (graphic user interface) database system that is user friendly and designed to work with Microsoft Office Suite applications.    Designed to allow only authorized users, OGC attorneys and support staff, access to subject matter databases on a need-to-know basis and can be made available to any OGC and Regional Counsel Office employee as necessary.    Designed to track matters according to a Product Line Crediting System (PLCS).   Accessed from individual workstations via GCLAWS client which accesses data on the GCLAWS server located in the relevant Regional Counsel office or General Counsel Central Office (OGCCO).    Rigid, in that certain data fields are required to establish records on the database, yet flexible enough to allow for future considerations, should the volume and scope of the Regional Counsels or Office of the General Counsel workload change.

name: Genomic Information System for Integrative Sciences
description: Genomic Information System for Integrative Sciences (GenISIS) is an informatics platform being developed to support all aspects of the Million Veteran Program (MVP).  MVP is a VA ORD initiative since 2011 to build a mega cohort of a million consented Veterans to obtain bio-samples and to integrate their clinical, self-reported and genomic data to advance research towards improving and personalizing health care delivery in the VA.  GenISIS currently supports functionalities like an electronic recruiting engine that has to date been used to recruit over 330,000 Veterans into MVP, a laboratory information management system that has helped in receiving, processing and storing over 330,000 samples and a genomic analysis platform that will allow discovery of the genetic basis of disease and better therapy for the Veterans.

name: GI Bill Comparison Tool
description: The GI Bill Comparison Tool (GI Bill CT), formerly known as CT, provides key information about college affordability and value so beneficiaries can choose the best education program for their needs. System is available at http://department-of-veterans-affairs.github.io/gi-bill-comparison-tool/.  System can also be accessed via https://www.vets.gov/.

name: GI Bill Feedback System
description: The GI Bill Feedback System (GI Bill FS), formerly known as FS, allows VA, with state and federal agencies, to work with educational institutions to address issues on behalf of Veterans, Service Members, and dependents utilizing VA educational benefits. The GI Bill Feedback System (GI Bill FS) allows recipients of VA educational benefits to submit complaints against educational institutions or employers they believe have acted erroneously, deceptively, with misleading recruiting practices, or in some other way have failed to follow the PoE.

name: Global War on Terror : Big 7 - OIF/OEF Combat Veteran Identifier
description: Provides visual representation in the Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS) to indicate the patient has served in combat in either Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) or Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF).

name: Gravesite Assessment Reporting
description: The Gravesite Assessment Reporting (GAR) application operates/functions within the Burial Operations Support System (BOSS) environment. It is accessed through the Quantico Regional Processing Center home page at http://vaww.cem.va.gov. The Gravesite Assessment Reporting (GAR) application delivers the semi-annual and fiscal year Gravesite Assessment reports. The reports collect information about the cleanliness, height and alignment of headstones/markers National Cemeteries. The Assessment is based on a random sampling of gravesites inspected by cemetery staff in April and October each year.

name: Health Based Primary Care
description: The VA Home Based Primary Care (HBC) information system is a patient-oriented system that describes each patient admitted to the program, health services provided, and the outcome of care. Input data is provided on three separate forms for each patient: an Evaluation/Admission form, a Discharge form, and a variable number of Visit Log forms. Medical Foster Home (MFH), a subset of HBC, offers adult foster care in a privately owned residence.  MFH data collects provider specific information, such as facility name, state and county code, maximum patients, date opened and closed, caregiver age, and number of bed bound.   The reports generated for this system are used locally for program management in establishing productivity standards, for program evaluation, and at the Central Office level for program planning, management, and evaluation.

name: Health Data Repository
description: The Health Data Repository (HDR) is a data repository of clinical information that resides on one or more independent platforms and is used by clinicians and other personnel to facilitate longitudinal patient-centric care. HDR II is a relational database that replaces HDR IMS, and stores discrete data rather than messages. It enables providers to obtain integrated data views and acquire the patient-specific clinical information needed to support treatment decisions. HDR II serves as the primary source of clinical data for the legal medical record. It maintains data supporting core business functions and serves as a platform for new and re-engineered HealtheVet applications.

name: Health Data Repository - Historical
description: Stores a copy of all clinical data in the HDR and makes it available for use by those performing warehousing activities such as research and management analysis.

name: Health Eligibility Center
description: HEC system inserts veteran specific data provided by Health Eligibility Center (HEC) into electronic forms/letters, print letters and forms and mails them to Veterans. The HEC database contains data relative to Income Verification Matching. The Health Eligibility Center (HEC) system sends eligibility data, enrollment data, income data, and means test data to the local VA Medical Centers (VAMCs) using HL7 messaging. Eligibility, enrollment, and income data are sent via a Z11 HL7 transmission; means test data via a Z10 HL7 transmission. In the event that a local VAMC is unable to process the information received, it will notify the HEC of a problem. This notification is transmitted via an Application Error (AE) message.

name: Health Eligibility Reports
description: Uses the Master Veteran Record (MVR) to match Veteran's social security number or VA claim numbers through various databases and produces report used to determine Veterans' eligibility for VHA medical services. (Need to confirm with AITC this system is still active)

name: Healthcare Claims Processing System
description: HCP is a pilot financial system. In order to meet the long term vision, the CBO has initiated the deployment of interim solutions and multiple pilots to support critical program needs. The pilots are intended to inform the long-term decision with expanded options on possible alternatives which include the national deployment of the Fee Basis Claims System (FBCS), a Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) product that was installed in 2010. In addition the CBO is engaging with the VA Financial Service Center (FSC) and Veterans Integrated Service Network (VISN) 11 to pilot a Healthcare Claims Processing (HCP) system with FSCs existing product line which is scheduled to be deployed in Indianapolis in the 4th quarter of FY2012. Bi directional interface--processes medical payments and provides users with an ACCEPT/REJECT report.

name: HealtheLiving Assessment
description: Also know as Health Risk Assessment (HRA), HLA provides a web-based survey instrument to assess Veteran s health status, behaviors, and other personal and family health information and provide tailored feedback, education, and recommendations The survey instrument will be integrated with Vista/CPRS.

name: Hearing Registry
description: Stores information on audiometric tests and processes a large digital computer, and analyzes it.  This repository enables limited capabilities for estimation of the magnitude of hearing loss, determining the incidence of hearing loss or tinnitus, and examination of trends of hearing loss or tinnitus, over time. HR HREG will allow more advanced analysis of associated conditions, population histories, and etiological factors related to Veteran hearing loss. Combined analyses using the HR and the Hearing Repository will continue the advancement of clinical practice, and provide better support for care assessment and service delivery for Veterans.

name: Home TeleHealth - Medtronic
description: Home Telehealth (HT) is a national program sponsored by VHA Office of Telehealth Services (OTS), providing care management for Veterans with complex chronic conditions to enable them to live independently in their homes. Vendor owned and operated systems - host only. Medical devices transmit electronic health information from the device to the HT server via a modem connection or Internet connection from patients home. Vendors monitor and maintain their system via vendor’s remote VA VPN. NOTE: Regarding the hosting locations, AITC is the primary hosting site.  HITC is the Disaster Recovery site (DR).  We switch operations quarterly, so at any given time either AITC or HITC can be the active primary site.

name: Home Telehealth 1 Vision
description: Home Telehealth (HT) is a national program sponsored by VHA Office of Telehealth Services (OTS), providing care management for Veterans with complex chronic conditions to enable them to live independently in their homes. Vendor owned and operated systems - host only. Medical devices transmit electronic health information from the device to the HT server via a modem connection or Internet connection from patients home. Vendors monitor and maintain their system via vendor’s remote VA VPN.

name: Home TeleHealth Care Innovations
description: [Per Reyes Ruiz, Care Innovations has been decommissioned as a VA system and not just removed from AITC.  Please close this effort once and for all.  from May 9, 2018, Home Telehealth Care Innovations (HTH-CI) #2194, needs to be removed from VASI; the system is being decommissioned, servers are being powered down today and totally removed from AITC NLT 5/31/2018. ]Home Telehealth (HT) is a national program sponsored by VHA Office of Telehealth Services (OTS), providing care management for Veterans with complex chronic conditions to enable them to live independently in their homes. Vendor owned and operated systems - host only. Medical devices transmit electronic health information from the device to the HT server via a modem connection or Internet connection from patients home. Vendors monitor and maintain their system via vendor’s remote VA VPN.

name: Home Telehealth Census and Survey
description: Database and web portal for reporting of Home Telehealth aggregate data; As of 5/25/17: Currently under existing Home Telehealth ATO, which is being separated into component system ATOs.

name: Home TeleHealth Iron Bow
description: [09/28/2017: XXX, HTH-Iron Bow is inactive as reported in email from XXXX, Program Analyst, Office of Connected Care Contracting Officer Representative (COR) Home TeleHealth, who stated Iron Bow contract officially terminated.  Stop work immediately with them.  Lets discuss on tomorrows call if you are available any removal of hardware, etc.]Home Telehealth (HT) is a national program sponsored by VHA Office of Telehealth Services (OTS), providing care management for Veterans with complex chronic conditions to enable them to live independently in their homes. Vendor owned and operated systems - host only. Medical devices transmit electronic health information from the device to the HT server via a modem connection or Internet connection from patients home. Vendors monitor and maintain their system via vendor’s remote VA VPN.

name: Home Telehealth Medtronic Blue Cedar
description: The VA TIC location supports the pass through of biometric data and video from home devices to the Home Telehealth System. The Home Telehealth System is a collection of vendor systems and is categorized as a major application. This system is a collection of servers, each of which supports vendor products that permit medical devices that reside in patient homes to transmit electronic health information from the device to a server within the VA environment via a VA provided modem connection or Internet connection, using a commercial Internet Service Provider (ISP). Many of these devices automate this process, dialing in automatically to the centralized servers and transmitting data on a regular basis or connecting to a predetermined URL. The patient data can then be viewed by clinicians, so that they can monitor the patients’ health via a web based application. The Home Telehealth vendor systems are located in both the Austin Information Technology Center (AITC) and the Hines Information Technology Center (HITC). Austin is considered the primary site, but the systems are mirrored in Hines and vendors regularly switch between sites in order to perform maintenance and upgrades. Individual vendors are responsible for monitoring and maintenance activities for the specific components of their system. These activities leverage a VA provided VPN connection, either client-to-site or site-to-site.

name: Home Telehealth Reporting Enhancements
description: Home Telehealth Reporting Enhancements (HTRE), formerly (Integrated Home Telehealth Application (IHTA)] is a cloud hosted web based system comprised of Home Telehealth Census and Survey CNS (VASI 2179) and Integrated Home Telehealth Application IHTA (formerly VASI 1359) components. It improves tools that Care Coordination nurses use to manage their panel of patients enrolled in the Home Telehealth program. The data from the tools are used by VHA to assess and improve Home Telehealth program outcomes and allows for updates to the system architecture to maintain security of Veteran data. HTRE supports the Home Telehealth program in improving clinical outcomes and access to care by reducing complications, hospitalizations, and clinic or emergency room visits for veterans who are at high risk due to a chronic disease. The enhancements will help veterans continue to live independently and spend less time at medical visits while providing veterans the knowledge and skills needed to more effectively self-manage their own health care needs. is a Web-based portal application sponsored by the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) Office of Telehealth Services (OTS).

name: Homeless Management Information System
description: Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) is a software application designed to record and store client-level information on the characteristics and service needs of homeless persons. An HMIS is typically a web-based software application that homeless assistance providers use to coordinate care, manage their operations, and better serve their clients. HMIS implementation presents communities with an opportunity to re-examine how homeless services are provided in their community, and to make informed decisions, and develop appropriate action steps. Because the implementation of HMIS systems varies from community to community, examples of local implementation covering the community planning process, software selection and implementation are available from a variety of communities.

name: Homeless Operations, Management and Evaluation System
description: HOMES is an online data collection system that tracks homeless Veterans as they move through VA's system of care. The system streamlines data collection processes and facilitates communication between VA homeless program staff and leadership on the local, regional, and nationals levels. By providing a centralized data collection system, HOMES enables VA to efficiently and effectively collect, manage and access homeless Veteran data.

name: Human Capital Management
description: This solution will allow Human Capital Management (HCM) to integrate several existing databases and other systems, plus a new web front end in support of 10,000+ positions and approximately 8,000 employees in OIT. We are looking for two replacement virtual servers configured similarly with IIS and SQL Server stand-alone instances installed on each machine so that windows authentication can be implemented. HCM staff will be the only users. This HCM system will not connect to any patient applications or systems.

name: IAM - Master Person Index
description: The Master Person Index (MPI), formerly known as the Master Veteran Index (MVI) and the Master Patient Index (MPI), is the primary system for assigning and maintaining unique person identifiers. MVI is the authoritative identity service within VA, establishing, maintaining and synchronizing identities for all VA persons of interest (e.g. Veterans, beneficiaries, dependents, employees, contractors, health professional trainees). A gateway in VistA establishes connectivity between VA Medical Center (VAMC) systems and patient registration processes and links to the MPI for message processing and patient identification. The MPI has been created to support maintenance of a unique person identifier (ICN) and a single master index of all Veterans Health Administration (VHA) patients and to allow messaging of patient information among the institutional partners [i.e., VHA, Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA), Board of Veterans Appeals (BVA), National Cemetery Service (NCS), and Department of Defense (DoD).] MPI creates an index that uniquely identifies each person known by the VA, identifies the sites where a patient is receiving care as well as correlations to other major VBA and NCA systems.

name: IAM - Provisioning
description: User provisioning is the process of associating a digital identity with one or more resource access accounts, which may serve as records for user data and permissions. This may include the creation, modification, deletion, suspension, or restoration of such accounts and also synchronizing user data. Managing user accounts locally creates redundancy in collecting and managing user information. This may lead to inaccuracies and inconsistencies with user data that is stored in authoritative sources, and this may also create security vulnerabilities by maintaining accounts for terminated users.

name: IAM - VA Logon
description: Currently, there are users who require access to VA applications and other VA resources who are unable to obtain a credential that provides them with this access. Veterans and other external users who do not have a DS Logon credential provided by the DoD are unable to access the VA health and benefits resources online that require authentication. Additionally, VA stakeholders (application owners, user advocates, and interested parties) do not have a means to provide credentials to support access to these applications and resources in a consistent manner. The VA Logon provides Level 2 credentialing for individuals who require access to VA applications, yet cannot obtain a credential from another provider for a variety of reasons.

name: IAM - Veterans Health Identification Card
description: The Veteran Health Identification Card (VHIC) is issued to Veterans who are enrolled in the VA health care system, and is used for identification and check-in at VA appointments.  The VHIC provides increased security for Veteran personal information - no personally identifiable information is contained on the magnetic stripe or barcode; unique Member Identifier the Department of Defense assigns an electronic data interchange personal identifier (EDIPI) that allows VA to retrieve the Veterans health record; a salute to Veteran military service the emblem of the latest branch of service is displayed on the card, and several special awards will also be listed; accessibility to Braille helps visually impaired Veterans to recognize and use the card; anti-counterfeiting micro text helps thwart reproductions. SDE-FO supports the operations of the VHIC equipment located at each facility, yet the master data is stored centrally @ Terremark, and VHA CBO Systems Management office has programmatic oversight of the entire operation.

name: IFCAP Training Database
description: [Received notification from VASI IO to mark system INACTIVE 06182018.] Non-production instance of IFCAP, hosted at AITC for FSC customer. Allows fiscal employee training. The training instance is NOT populated with real employee or business data.

name: Information Technology Acquisition Request System
description: The Information Technology Acquisition Request System (ITARS) is a web-based application which handles the request and approval process by providing data entry; transaction editing; certification of need; management review and reporting; and approval processing.  ITARS is designed to provide several levels of functionality and authority to support the reporting, certification, and approval of IT procurement requests.

name: Inquiry Routing and Information System
description: The Department of Veterans Affairs handles inquiries via the Inquiry Routing and Information System (IRIS) that is reached via the 'Contact Us' link that appears on the top of the VA home page. The original IRIS was a very basic pilot application that was developed as a sidebar to the Veteran-Focused Internet Redesign Project of 2001; it was replaced in November 2002 by a customized version of a commercial product known as RightNow Technologies E-Service Center. This application is an official System of Records that provides VA customers with secure communication of personal data, should they voluntarily choose to send it to VA; it has been customized over time to meet the needs of VA and its Veterans and other external users and is upgraded periodically to optimize and improve its functionality and utility.VA has a worldwide customer base that demands information and services 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Veteran and other customer traffic to VA’s web site continues to increase, clearly demonstrating the utility of the web site for providing robust customer service to our veterans, business partners, and other customers. IRIS allows customers to self-direct a question, suggestion, compliment, complaint, request for a status of claim or appeal, or any other question to the appropriate VA office. VBA call centers also use the IRIS to record and route inquiries that are received by telephone and which the call center agents are unable to answer in real time while on those calls. The system provides a mechanism by which VA management can track the number of inquiries received through the IRIS vehicle and the response time in providing customer service to our inquirers, along with providing other quality control features for VA managers.Usage of the IRIS has grown exponentially since its inception; currently, the IRIS system handles approximately 50,000 inquiries per month and has 475 mailgroups across VA, including all VBA Regional Offices, all VA Medical Centers and VISN Offices, all branches of the National Cemetery Administration, the E-Benefits Help Desk, the MyHealtheVet help desk staff, and numerous other entities/mailgroups. Components of the commercial product were adapted to VA's use and include: the department's Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Knowledge Base that must be populated and maintained by appropriate designated VA staff;, the ability to receive and respond to veteran inquiries; the ability to track inquiries, turnaround time, and other statistical data; an extensive reports capability to generate reports with useful information to VA's IRIS community and VA management.This website publishes to the VA Intranet the documents associated with the RightNow application implementation plus instruction guides and a monthly summary of IRIS inquiry receipts.

name: Insurance Capture Buffer Web
description: The ICB program is an insurance card scanning and Vista Buffer File update management system designed to enhance the insurance data collection and verification processes for Veterans Affairs facilities. The ICB Graphical User Interface (GUI) is integrated with several Vista components such as Appointment Scheduling and the Patient Insurance File. ICB allows users to easily view and update information stored within the VistA insurance company and veteran insurance file database. ICB provides intake staff an electronic list of veterans with scheduled appointments whose insurance requires verification prior to the appointment. The “Patient Update” worklist is used by check-in/check-out and registration clerks to scan insurance cards for those identified on the list. The worklist displays according to clinic configurations according to the specific user profile. Scanned images are stored in an IT specified server folder and are immediately accessible to insurance verification clerks via the “Insurance Buffer Entries” list. Data from the image can be compared to existing insurance data within the veteran’s permanent insurance file in VistA. A reporting utility is available to Business Office managers to ensure the compliance of Entry Clerks and insurance verification personnel with this initiative. VHA Directive 1910 mandates the use of ICB for requesting and verifying insurance information. As Entry Clerks populate the insurance buffer via the ICB software, the electronic Insurance Verification (eIV) VistA software automatically sends and receives electronic inquiries in real-time from available third-party payers. These Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) functions are in compliance with HIPAA mandated industry standards. The resulting electronic response can auto-update to the patient file or is available for insurance verification staff processing.

name: Insurance Payment System
description: The Insurance Payment System runs on the IBM server at the Philadelphia ITC (Information Technology Center, co-located with the VAROIC).This is the master system of records for Insurance policyholders and beneficiaries, although detail and aggregate data may be replicated in other systems.  This system generates mail annually, and produces the disbursement files and other external interfaces to Treasury, SSA, and DoD.  This is the oldest Insurance system, and many programs were translated from machine languages in the 1980s, but other programs including DD/EFT (direct deposit) and the matches with SSA are recent additions.  It uses flat files to transmit master records to other systems. Its subsystems include: Insurance In-Force System, Insurance Awards System, VICTARS, Dividends, Deduction

name: Insurance S-DVI Application
description: Insurance S-DVI is an online application for insurance which its data output creates the VICTARS record.  Electronic Insurance (EINS) - Level 2 self-registration single-login solution, acts as an entry point and provides authentication for VA Life Insurance web applications. The solution will integrate external data sources (i.e. public records, credit header data, financial databases, etc.) to achieve a NIST Level 2 identity verification of users prior to authorizing login credentials.

name: Insurance Self Service
description: The Insurance website is housed at the Philadelphia ITC.  It includes general information and links, forms, and on-line applications.  These applications are all part of the Insurance Self-Service System. They may also request a policy loan.  A PIN number is required.  It must be requested on-line, and is mailed to the veteran s address of record.  For more sensitive functions, such as a loan request, a second self-selected password is also needed. These applications are all part of the Insurance Self-Service System.   UFN (Unclaimed Funds by Name) is a search by name, social security number or other identifying data to see if Insurance might be holding a returned check or other unclaimed liability.  This application is available to the general public.   The insurance automated form application (AUTOFORM) allows veterans with a rating for a new disability to apply for Service Disabled Veterans Insurance online.  Applicants can submit their applications electronically or print and mail their completed application. The on-line form uses  turbo-tax  type questions to help determine eligibility.    Insurance Self-Service has been implemented in four phases.

name: Integrated Operations Platform
description: IOP is a custom-built, enterprise-wide single platform through which project teams can rapidly stand-up sites for project management and collaboration. It provides: user-friendly decision support tools; maintains a data repository of historical data; analytics support to stakeholders; information sharing so teams can learn best practices and barrier-avoidance; near-real time transparency into enterprise-wide activities and barriers.

name: Interactive Customer Evaluation System
description: 4/20/17: Stakeholder (Adriana Vale) designated ICE (2059) as INACTIVE since it has been canceled and being replaced by VOICE (2141); The Interactive Customer Evaluation (ICE) system provides a web based tool for collecting patient/customer feedback (ratings and comments) related to the quality of services and/or products provided by VA facilities.

name: Invoice Payment Processing System
description: Invoice Payment Processing System (IPPS) receives electronic invoice data and provides approval/acceptance workflow and FMS payment transaction creation. IPPS is an internet portal for invoice processing. Instated in 2014, IPPS is an enterprise-level payment system that handles as many types of payments as possible, and is primarily used to handle VA payments to commercial vendors. Benefit payments are processed in VBA systems. Payments to government entities are processed through IPAC with the exception of the Postal Service. We capture maximum dollar savings processing payments for those invoices requiring a receiving report with prompt and accurate service. We offer our innovative On-Line Certification System (OLCS) in conjunction with our certified invoice payment processing to provide you with the most reliable and efficient payment processing services. FSC's payment services allow you to work more efficiently and effectively within your organization. These are just a few reasons to do business with us: Full compliance with the Prompt Payment Act and OMB Circular A-123 Internal Control Management ensuring your payments are made correctly. The On-Line Certification System (OLCS) allows our customers to electronically certify invoices via the Intranet. Post Audit services on statistically selected invoices.

name: IT Performance Dashboard
description: CSSD Analysis and Reporting Program will provide the capabilities required to automate the collection, analysis, and reporting of customer service data using an enterprise data warehouse solution.  The project will deliver software development, testing, and documentation for all requirements identified in the Performance Work Statement (PWS) to stand-up the data warehouse.

name: James A Lovell Federal Health Center
description: National Defense Authorization Acts of FY2009 and FY2010 authorized the establishment of a joint VA and DoD health care center, James A. Lovell Federal Health Care Center (JALFHCC) in North Chicago. This information exchange is supported by VA DoD bi-directional interoperability between VAs Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS)/Veterans Health Integrated Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) clinical systems of record and DoDs Armed Forces Health Longitudinal Technology Application (AHLTA) and Composite Health Care System (CHCS). JALFHCC requires new functionalities within its capability set to ensure patient safety, better coordinated patient care, and increase efficiencies between VA and DoD information systems. The enhancements will allow the vendor to implement identified priorities for patient safety improvements to include bi-directional synchronization of Progress Notes in VA/CPRS with Encounters in the DoD/AHLTA and CHCS as well as synchronization of patient allergy information (Allergy Portability) utilizing Health Connect. Both business functions currently required manual entry, introducing the risk of human error in addition to the inefficiencies of duplicate manual processes. In addition, the completion of the Financial Management Reconciliation capability currently being processed manually.

name: Joint Legacy Viewer
description: The Joint Legacy Viewer is a patient-centric, web presentation system that pulls information from disparate health-care systems in real time for presentation in a browser design. The web application provides the ability to view specific clinical data stored in any electronic medical record systems available to the Veterans Administration and the Department of Defense. Authorized users from each site can access a patient’s clinical data via a web front end via a browser from within the site’s intranet. The Joint Legacy Viewer provides a common data view of read-only, real-time patient information from separate and distinct electronic medical record systems. A user has access to a provider portal, which provides information specific to a clinician.

name: Kidney Dialysis Registry
