description: The Kidney Dialysis Registry is intended to become part of the Health Registries' Converged Registries Solution (CRS) program. The Dialysis Registry's plan will use the CRS to validate, analyze, report, and potentially edit Veterans' and related dependents' health related information from authoritative sources such as VISTA/CDW via the CRS platform currently integrated with Master Verification Index (MVI).

name: LGY eBenefits Portlet
description: The COE portlet is a WSRP 286 compliant portlet running on a Weblogic Portal application server. The portlet is produced by LGY and consumed by the eBenefits portal for Veteran self-service. The COE portlet queries Veteran's information from the Corporate, VADIR and LGY databases to determine home loan eligibility. The veteran may print his COE from the portlet or upload supporting documentation if needed.

name: Liela Hooks Diamond Award
description: Chief Business Office Purchased Care (CBOPC) Awards management system

name: Loan Guaranty
description: The WebLGY application is the primary LGY business support system. WebLGY is responsible for managing the processes and data involved with the VA home loan program, from historical VA Home Loan records to determining eligibility, appraising, guaranteeing new loans and managing them through termination including several pieces of oversight.  Other applications in the LGY suite include the SAHSHA application which manages the issuance of Specially Adapted Housing (SAH) grants.  Stakeholder information in regards to the Loan Guaranty and SAH application are managed in the SIM application.  WebLGY uses portal technology.

name: Loan Guaranty Hub
description: LGY Hub is a generalized application designed to replace the VIP (Veterans Information Portal) which is the front-end application to other LGY (Loan Guaranty) applications and functions. All users will come to LGY Hub to access both internal and external LGY applications. It provides authentication by having the user login to AccessVA (an IAM product) which uses PIV authentication for internal VA users and ID.me for 2 factor authentication for external users. Once authenticated LGY either takes the user to a screen to select which LGY application they want to use or sends them to a registration function to associate their user information with data in LGY to allow access.  LGY Hub uses Access Manager to obtain role and functionality information for each user that logs in to determine which applications and functions they can use. It uses Java and Spring on the backend and React/Redux on the frontend

name: Loan Service and Claims
description: (Retired January 2012 - per 2FA team)  Loan Administration monitors and evaluates the servicing of guaranteed loans by holders and servicers utilizing output from the Loan Service and Claims System to assure timely efforts are made to service and, as applicable, terminate loans determined insoluble.

name: LOG Procurement History and Catalog
description: Collects data based on purchase orders and amendments generated in Integrated Funds Control, Accounting and Procurement (IFCAP).  The data is used for statistical analysis and as a basis for standardization of certain items.

name: Logistics - Forms and Publications
description: Supports the storage, ordering and distribution of forms, publications and various other items stocked at the Service Distribution Center (SDC).

name: Long Term Solution
description: CH33 LTS is an Information Technology (IT) system designated as a major application and used globally to process Veterans educational benefits in accordance with the Post-9/11 Veterans Educational Assistance Act of 2008.  The Chapter 33 GI Bill is a Congressionally mandated bill that provides continuing education benefits (post-secondary) to our Nation’s Veterans. Veterans who served in the U.S. Military Post-9/11 are eligible for this program. The benefits include tuition, books, and a Basic Housing Allowance (BHA). The Long Term Solution (LTS) is an application that automates the processing of Veteran claims. This is an important effort as Chapter 33 has paid out over $43B in payments to 1.3M Veterans, and the effort related to the processing of benefits is labor intensive.  It has been built outside VA and hosted in Terremark Data Center. It is Web J2EE application and communicated with various other VBA Education Services applications through web services.

name: Low ADL Monitoring Program
description: The Low ADL (Activities of Daily Living) Monitoring Program (LAMP) web application is used for daily remote monitoring of Veterans enrolled in LAMP. LAMP is a Care Coordination Home Telehealth (CCHT) program designed to address the needs of Veterans who have difficulty completing their activities of daily living. The daily communication afforded by the use of this web application allows Veterans and their care coordinators/occupational therapists to stay in close contact, assuring that their health and functional status is being monitored on a much more frequent basis than would be through routine clinic visits. This communication platform provides for continuous care coordination and support of the Veteran and in turn their families/caregivers. The Database contains a pool of questions, a set of enrolled Veteran's, answers by the Veteran's to the questions assigned to them, and subject grouped message threads sent between Care Coordinators and Veterans.

name: Machine Learning Decision Support
description: MLDS is VHA and Veterans, who are involved with the prescription billing process. The improved timely identification and correction of pharmacy billing error is needed that leverages machine learning to interpret model outputs to correct inappropriate copay statuses. Unlike the current process, which allows for inaccurate prescription collections, UML provides an automated process for the prescription billing which identifies anomalies in real-time reports and reduces the number of billing errors and incorrect copayments benefiting leadership and frontline staff, and ultimately saving money for both VHA and the Veteran. The goal of UML is to implement audit and correction systems to ensure the timely and proper billing of prescriptions subject to special eligibilities. The use of machine learning to identify billing errors has been reduced to practice using an augmented pharmacist tertiary review. The next phase is to emphasize automation to aid in the just and ethical application of prescription benefits and integration of recommender systems into the electronic health records.

name: Mail Server MUMPS Farm
description: Provides SNMP messaging services for handling transaction messages to and from the VHA facilities. Messages are transferred from and to DMI for interfacing with various applications.

name: Management and Decision Support System
description: The Management And Decision Support System (MADSS) was developed to improve the accuracy and timeliness of NCA management information.  The system allows national cemetery employees to input workload and personnel data.  It allows the employee to input current data and or make corrections to the previous months  data.  The system also receives interment data from the BOSS application.

name: Managerial Cost Accounting - Reporting
description: Formerly known as Decision Support System - Reporting.  This system is the reporting module of VA’s Managerial Cost Accounting (MCA) system.

name: Medical Care Collections Fund Transactions Applications Suite
description: Medical Care Collections Fund (MCCF) Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) Transaction Applications Suite (TAS) is a cloud-based Service-Oriented Architecture system that delivers Medical Care Collection Fund business services. The platform transitions business logic from existing VistA capabilities to a modernized solution while VistA remains as the authoritative data source. All information under this new platform is only accessible by authorized users on the VA network. Four MCCF EDI lines of business (eBilling, eInsurance, ePayment and ePharmacy) will require financial transaction processing to/from the Financial Services Center in Austin in addition to other web services. The revenue captured by this system provides funding for critical services utilized by veterans at VA Medical Centers.

name: Medical Care Cost Recovery National Database
description: Provides a repository for summary MCCR billing and collection information used by program management to compare facility performance.

name: Medical Domain Web Services
description: Medical Domain Web Services (MDWS) (pronounced meadows) is a suite of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) middle-tier web services that exposes medical domain functionality, Medical Domain Objects (MDO). MDWS is equipped with the capacity to virtualize any legacy Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) Remote Procedure Call (RPC) as a web service. A web service is an Application Programming Interface (API), which uses Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP), the standardized protocol to communicate with subscribed client applications.

name: Medical SAS File
description: Provides a variety of SAS-formatted files containing medical data for use by VA Staff.

name: Medicare Remittance Advice
description: The introduction of Medicare Remittance Advice (MRA) software allows sites to receive an Explanation of Benefits (EOB) from Medicare (CMS). MRA information is used to create a secondary bill to those payers who require an EOB from Medicare prior to making payment

name: Medication Order Check Healthcare Application
description: Medication Order Check Healthcare Application (MOCHA) provides order checking functionality to address a number of critical patient safety issues. When a VA provider orders a drug, MOCHA performs order checks on that drug and alerts the provider if that drug has any of the following anomalies: causes an interaction with other drugs the patient is taking; is in the same Therapeutic Class as other drugs the patient is taking; or is prescribed in a dose that is incompatible with patient factors such as age, weight and Body Surface Area.

name: Medication Reconciliation
description: The Medication Reconciliation Profiles are Health Summaries that provide an alphabetized list of patient medications from several sources, including outpatient prescriptions, unit dose medications, non-VA documented medications, and active remote VA medications and contain a section labeled  Other medications previously dispensed in the last year  for discontinued meds. While creating a list, a series of  order couplets  are generated that can be used to identify orders that should be added, discontinued, changed, or left as-is. These summaries are most commonly used at hospital admission and discharge, when the patient is transitioning between inpatient and outpatient status.

name: Medication Reconciliation and Allergy Review
description: [INACTIVE] System designated as inactive per following statement:CO405763FY17 Retirement of Application MRAR. The MRAR project has been closed and there will be no further development. Please release the AITC environment.  Clinical software supporting medication and allergy review processes at VHA facilities across the country.  Veteran inputs are planned for kiosk and possibly online prior to visit.  Nurses and Doctors will be able to review this information on clinical notes in the TIU module in VistA.   The innovative technical capabilities to rapidly access and present allergies and medications drawn in near real time from any number of VistA's are based on VistA.js and VistA Service Assembler (VSA). MRAR will replace Medication Reconciliation (MedRecon) - #1931.

name: Medispan Audit
description: To assist with the conduct of Medispan Audits.

name: Memorial Enterprise Letters
description: The current MEL custom solution will be replaced with a configurable lightweight correspondence engine allowing NCA to build new letter templates and automate business rules for template approval.  This eliminates NCA's dependency on Information Technology (IT) support for letter template creation or edits.

name: Mental Health
description: Interface for historical lookup of Medical Opinions on Mental Health Claims.  Business is considering discontinuing service.

name: Mental Health Assistant
description: The VistA Mental Health Assistant is the graphical user interface (GUI) for the VistAMental Health Package (MHP) assessment module. MHA was developed to create an effective and efficient tool for clinicians and their patients to use for the administration and scoring of standardized assessment instruments and interviews. Additionally, results are displayed in report and graphical formats. MHA supports assessments  that are not available elsewhere in theComputerized Patient Record System (CPRS)/Veterans Information System and TechnologyArchitecture (VistA) and stores the administrations as data.

name: Mental Health Quality & Clinical Outcomes Reporting System
description: Mental Health Services (MHS) within the VHA Office of Patient Care Services (PCS) supports the need for a mental health patient population management tool/registry/information system to track and monitor patients throughout the entire course of their mental health treatment. This is a new-start development project for FY16.

name: Messaging Administration Repository Maintenance Dashboard
description: The Messaging Administration Repository facilitates the communication between the VA's Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) and various systems and commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products. Efficient exchange of information between healthcare systems and software applications is vital for providing timely and correct healthcare to veterans. The MARM Dashboard is a process support tool that is designed for internal use to the OIT EPMO MARM team. The tool will sit on VA servers. VA has been very active in the utilization of Health Level 7 (HL7) standard messages for integration of external systems and COTS products with VistA. The MARM team will continue to provide message administration technical support service to OIT EPMO development and sustainment project using the MARM portal for activities that facilitate HL7 coaching, development, testing and approval.

name: MetaKnowledge Repository
description: MKR is a web-based application that delivers the capability for users to manage, search, and discover metadata for knowledge assets known as individual agents (people), organizational agents (organizations), automated agents (systems), activities (processes), and artifacts (documents). MKR is an application that enables users in various roles to view, add, delete, manage, and search for instances of metadata associated with knowledge assets that collectively comprise the knowledge flows supporting VA business processes. MKR provides the capability to store and search these metadata knowledge assets. MKR is available to users through the VA intranet.

name: Million Veterans Program (MVP) Patient Recruitment and Enrollment System
description: The Million Veterans Program (MVP) Patient Recruitment and Enrollment System (RNE) is 12 servers spanning the Production, Preproduction, Development and Test environments. The system is housed at the AITC and is managed by IO. MVP is a national, voluntary research program aiming to study how genes affect health, specifically, the health military veterans. The program was created and is overseen by the VHA Office of Research and Development (ORD) and is coordinated by the Massachusetts Veterans Epidemiology Research Information Center (MAVRIC) and other program units within the VA. Participation involves the recruitment of participants, enrollments into the program, engagement for continued activity tracking and feedback to Veterans and staff. The Genomic Informatics System for Integrative Sciences (GenISIS) will identify veterans by searching the VA EMR data for veterans who have received VA medical care within the last three years. Patient contact information will be imported in to GenISIS and sent to an outside contracting mail center for MVP invitation mailings. the Patient Recruitment and Enrollment System (RNE) application provides interfaces and extension points to transact recruitment and enrollment data stores housed in the GenISIS (GIS) data store. In order to provide future extensibility, participants events in the data stores follow a parent-child design pattern.

name: MIRECC/CoE Educational Products
description: The DB will be used to display data regarding the activities of the 10 national MIRECCs. There is no PHI. MIRECC activities include: - presentations provided - educational products - papers published - grants.

name: Modern Awards Processing - Development
description: Supports development of claims, and workflow tracking. MAP-D provides single processing development capability. This addresses complete claims development, claims status, and case management using the best features of existing applications. MAP-D also provides access to those applications that support the claims development process including COVERS, CSS, PIES, AVAIS, BDN, BIRLS and SPP.

name: Monitor Feedback
description: The Monitor Feedback application is designed to expedite customer feedback for deployments. The deployments include COTS products and Group Policy Object (GPO) configurations. Field users will submit their feedback, expressing any issues they are experiencing because of a recently deployed product. Select IT personnel will generate reports, to determine which users are experiencing issues and where they are located. This data will be used to not only solve issues in the field but also to help prevent and/or mitigate future issues with deployments. The target audience will be all VBA personnel.

name: Monitoring Service Registry
description: The Monitoring Service Registry (MSR) tool was developed for monitoring request intake, tracking, reporting and full lifecycle management of monitoring services.

name: Move! Coach
description: Veterans Health Administration mobile is the technology to help Veterans improve their lifestyle and health. It is split into two sub-programs, MOVE! Coach Mobile App (MCM) and MOVE! Coach Clinician Connect (MCC). The MCM is the Veteran-facing functionality weight management app for mobile operating systems iOS and Android. The MCC was conceived as a web application to provide the connection for clinicians to monitor progress, communicate with the Veteran, and to more easily document Veteran care provided.

name: Multiple Sclerosis Surveillance Registry
description: The Multiple Sclerosis Surveillance Registry (MSSR) is a surveillance system for the entire Multiple Sclerosis patient population within the VA.  It provides clinicians with the ability to input, monitor, retrieve, analyze, and report data pertaining to MS patients.

name: My HealtheVet
description: My HealtheVet (MHV) is a Web-based application that creates a new, online environment where Veterans, family, and clinicians may come together to optimize veterans  health care. This Web technology combines essential health record information enhanced by online health resources to enable and encourage patient/clinician collaboration.It improves Veteran health care by providing easy access to health information, online resources, and facilitates patient/health care provider interactions. MHV gives the Veteran access to VA benefits, special programs, and health information and services. It also provides the Veteran web-based tools to increase their knowledge about health conditions, manage their health records, and communicate with health care providers. Veterans now have the ability to take a more proactive approach to managing their health and utilizing VA health services and benefits

name: MyCareer@VA
description: 6/8/17: Per email , MyCareer@VA is now INACTIVE.The MyCareer@VA web portal provides both VA and non-VA employees a web tool to explore the vast array of opportunities at the VA and enable them to develop their talents and grow their careers at the VA. The externally-hosted web portal shows the users what opportunities are available at the VA and what steps they need to follow to take advantage of an opportunity.

name: National Cardiac Device Surveillance Program Web Portal
description: NCDSP uses the Paceart Optima System produced by Medtronic, Inc., an FDA approved Windows application interfacing with SQL Server, to store and administer patient data. The NCDSC Portal web application was developed as an interface to the Optima database and is a key patient care and service tool used by VA doctors, nurses, and clinical staff from 150 VHA medical facilities across the country.

name: National Clozapine Registry
description: The National Clozapine Registry (NCR) is a SQL database with a web-based GUI that contains information on VA clozapine users. The National Clozapine Coordinating Center uses the NCR to store information required by the FDA's Clozapine Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy on VA clozapine patient including clozapine registration, blood test results, prescriptions, VA clozapine prescribers, and VA pharmacies. This system will replace VA National Clozapine Registry (VA NCR) VASI ID #1668 which is expected to be decommissioned in June 2019.

name: National Education WAVE Mass Address Navigator
description: NEWMAN was developed to automate the process of changing the veterana's address information on the Benefits Delivery Network (BDN). Information submitted to the Web Automated Verification of Enrollment (WAVE) application is sent in a format for NEWMAN to read. NEWMAN enters the information into the BDN in the same manner as a user would manually. Records that NEWMAN is unable to update will be listed in the reject portion of the summary and reject report and given to a user to manually input. The summary portion consists of an overall count of the number of records received, processed, and rejected in addition to a breakdown by Regional Processing Office (RPO). The reject portion reflects all of the change of address information sent in the original file and the reject message. NEWMAN can now update direct deposit information as well.

name: National Finance Center Printing
description: [Received notification on 07112018 GAO Request: CO489939FY18 Retire Effective Immediately: MCC X27: GAO application and affiliated subapplication NFP occurrence All occurrences of NFP has been deleted from CA7. ] A set of biweekly reports generated primarily from the National Finance Center (NFC) based Mission and Assignment Tracking System (MATS).

name: National Health Care Practitioner Database
description: This database is part of the National Medical Information System (NMIS). The National Health Care Practitioner Database (NHCPD) supports Veterans Health Administration Privacy Act requirements by segregating personal information about health care practitioners such as name and social security number from patient information recorded in the National Patient Care Database for Ambulatory Care Reporting and Primary Care Management Module.

name: National Item File
description: The NIF application and servers is used to standardize Item Master File Records within afacilities IFCAP System. The NIF application also stores additional manufacturing informationabout the items, their manufacturers, and other salient characteristics associated with a givenitem. The Supply Chain Data and Informatics Office (SCDIO) uses this application to sync databetween each of the individual IFCAP instances.

name: National Laboratory Workload and Laboratory Management Index Program
description: Provides medical center to medical center comparisons capabilities. Provides capability for each local medical center to monitor laboratory trends for decision making. Provides a detailed view of workload data to support a variety of management and clinical requirements and needs.

name: National Medical Information System
description: The National Medical Information System is a combination of the National Patient Care Database (NPCD), the Patient Treatment File (PTF) and the National Health Care Practitioner Database (NHCPD). These databases act as a single system for Health Care Resource Management and Research. In compliance with the Federal Information System Management Act (FISMA) they are reported as a single system. Data extracts from NMIS are created using Statistical Analysis Software (SAS) and stored on the Austin Information Technology Center mainframe as medical SAS Files (see MDP Med SAS File).

name: National Patient Care Database
description: The National Patient Care Database (NPCD), located at the Austin Information Technology Center, is part of the National Medical Information Systems (NMIS).  The NPCD collects integrated patient care data from all Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) IT systems.  Data recorded in the VistA Patient Care Encounter (PCE) package, which captures clinical data resulting from ambulatory care patient encounters is transmitted to the NPCD using the Ambulatory Care Reporting (ACR) Module of the VistA Patient Information Management System (PIMS) package. The Ambulatory Care Reporting Module provides necessary information on patient treatment, what services were rendered to patients, who provided the services, and whether services reported were synchronized with the VA medical center database. Provides integrated patient care data across VHA facilities and care setting. Provides comprehensive data for research studies. Provides information for workload analysis. Provides data for patient care analysis.

name: National Prosthetic Patient Database
description: The National Prosthetics Patient Database (NPPD) established a central database of Prosthetics data recorded at each Veterans Health Administration facility. Its objective was to enable clinical reviews to increase quality, reduce costs, and improve efficiency of the Prosthetics program. Increase the quality of the services to our Veterans by providing a means to develop consistency in services, review prescription and management practices, develop training, monitor Home Medical Equipment, and measure performance improvements. Reduce costs by comparing costs system-wide, identifying common items for consolidated contracting, identifying costs for Medical Cost Care Funds (MCCF) purposes and improving contracting cost benefit. Improve efficiency by validating the data, improving budget management, determining where coding errors occur, providing training, and comparing unique social security numbers for multiple site usage and item issue. The NPPD Menu provides patient information, patient eligibility, Prosthetic treatment, date of provision, cost, vendor, and purchasing agent information. This system tracks average cost data and its usage and provides on both a monthly and quarterly basis detailed and summary reports by station, Veterans Integrated Service Network (VISN) and agency. The NPPD Menu resides in Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) at the medical center level. This data is updated quarterly. Data is rolled up at each facility and transmitted to Hines. The data is then loaded into the Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW) from which data extracts are done. The data is also put into a ProClarity cube and is available to VA local, regional, and national managers online. National managers have the ability to properly monitor, oversee and manage the national program and regional managers are able to effectively manage their respective areas using this tool. The primary purpose of this database is to provide financial and clinical oversight of the Prosthetics program and is used primarily by the Prosthetics and Sensory Aids (PSA) including VISN staff, VISN Prosthetics Representatives, Prosthetics Program Managers and other Prosthetics staff.

name: National Provider Identification Crosswalk
description: National Provider Identifier (NPI) was established by Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services as a way to uniquely identify all healthcare providers in the US. (see https://www.cms.gov/Regulations-and-Guidance/Administrative-Simplification/NationalProvIdentStand/). The NPI application gathers all NPI numbers from each VA medical center and compiles them into a single enterprise level report.

name: National Silent Monitoring
description: [10/27/16 - Based on the RVWG meeting today, this system has been removed from service.] A VBA Intranet application that records the Information taken from each silently monitored call, and be able to produce data and reports such as the issues and answers discussed during silently monitored calls.

name: National Utilization Management Integration
description: The National Utilization Management Integration (NUMI) application is a web-based solution that automates utilization review assessment and outcomes. The Utilization Management (UM) Process is a tool used to help ensure that patients are receiving the right care, at the right time, and in the right place. UM is both a quality and efficiency tool, as it is used to move patients efficiently through the VA system to maximize use of resources. UM reviewers assess patient admissions and hospital stay days using standardized objective evidence-based clinical criteria to determine whether patients meet criteria for acute hospital care.

name: Nationwide Gravesite Locator
description: The Nationwide Gravesite Locator (NGL) is a system designed to assist the public with locating a gravesite for which a government marker was provided. The NGL receives a data feed from both BOSS and AMAS databases and is kept constantly up to date. NGL is considered an NCA Mission critical system.

name: Non-Receipt of Benefit Checks Program
description: Non-Receipt of Benefit Checks Program (RECERT)

name: Non-VA Hospital Administration Statistics System
description: Determines appropriate Diagnosis-related group codes, computes payments to be made, and issues reports for Medical Administration Service and fiscal offices.

name: Non-VA Hospital System
description: The VHA pays for care provided to VA beneficiaries in non-VA hospitals through its contract hospitalization program as mandated by Congress in the late 1980s. NVH provides cost and DRG info to VAMCs for private care hospitalizations.

name: Nuclear Medicine National Headquarter System
description: Consists of information from all VAMCs performing or contracting nuclear medicine Services. Access Database provides an annual report summarizing the information received from all the VAMCs submitting questionnaires.

name: OAL Unauthorized Commitments Ratifications System
description: An automated system for Office of Acquisition and Logistics (OAL) unauthorized commitment ratification tracking, approval, workflow, and document retention in accordance with VA policies so that OAL will not need to manually process unauthorized commitment ratifications.

name: Occupational Health Record-Keeping System
description: Occupational Health Record-keeping System (OHRS) is part of the Clinical Information Support System (CISS) portal framework and the initial CISS partner system.  OHRS is a web-based portal application that enables employee occupational health staff to create, maintain, and monitor medical records for VA employees and generate national, Veterans Integrated Service Network (VISN), and site-specific reports.  OHRS collects clinical data for immunizations, wellness, medical surveillance, and appropriate treatment of work-based injury or illness. OHRS captures and stores information on VA employee patient encounters, such as encounter type, purpose, status, provider, and other pertinent clinical data obtained during the patient visit.

name: Office of Academic Affiliations (OAA) Support Center System
description: The flagship of the Office of Academic Affiliations (OAA) web applications, this portal (http://vaww.oaa.med.va.gov) isresponsible for 18 separate database entry points that open and close throughout the year,accepting obligatory facility and VISN data. Field input of requested/filled resident positions,associated health requested/filled positions, quarterly adjustments of allocated funds,submission of Standards of Excellence Forms, Advanced Fellow tracking, Health ServicesTraining headcounts, VACAA positions requests, and the Annual Report on Residency TrainingPrograms to name a few databases. In addition, over 50 reports are available.

name: Online Form Submission
description: Online Form Submissions (OFS) is an online form entry portal internally used for FSC that enables organizations to accurately and efficiently automate the workflow of requests through the organization. Forms can be easily added to the system by scanning original forms as PDFs and importing them into the system and applying rules and routing appropriately. The first document that has been added to the system is the 9957 access request form. Like the manual process, the same fields must be populated with information on the online form, but the online form will auto populate much of the information if it is available in the Global Address List (GAL) simply by entering the users email address first. The online form also has the ability to ensure requests are routed to the correct individuals, thereby removing guess work and improving efficiency of requests by having designated routes for all available tasks. For this reason, tasks may no longer be entered into the requests manually. For assistance with locating specific tasks or to have additional tasks added to the form, email FSCDMSSG@va.gov with your requests.

name: Operation Enduring Freedom Database
description: [System marked INACTIVE per VTWG of 4 June 2019. Per CO541446FY19, OEF is no longer active. Application status was confirmed with Customer POC on 4/8/19. This was a mainframe application with no servers or anything that needs decommissioning.] Development, maintenance of a system to process letter requests, print and mail the letters to recently discharged service personnel.  Created to segregate OEC letter processing costs for the Health Eligibility Center (HEC).

name: OPRM Platform
description: [3/21/16 - Security boundary retired from Risk Vision. This now retired boundary was the source data for the creation of this system in VASI.]  The OPRM Platform is providing GSS based functionality for 9 Office of Privacy and Records Management (OPRM) applications.

name: Ordering Officer Delegation
description: OOD provides the ability for Contracting Officers to assign and manage Ordering Officer delegation electronically. OOD interfaces with eCMS (via ESB) to ensure applicable clauses and contract provisions exist to allow ordering officer delegation, and ensures that only the CO of record can complete all delegations OOD provides the ability for a CO to delegate multiple authorities via a single interface (built to support contracts such as Med Surge Prime Vendor that have over 3,000 delegated ordering officers)

name: ORM Web Based Tracking
description: The Complaint Tracking System follows cases through both the informal and formal phases of the investigation providing the current disposition. The system also generates monthly and quarterly progress/workload reports.

Other Government Agencies Medical Claims Processing
name: Pathology Laboratory Medicine Service
description: The Pathology Laboratory Medicine Service (LAB) application resides on the AITC’s IBM z13 mainframe server and is designed to collect, store and report on pathology laboratory medical data. Laboratory medical transactions are transmitted to Austin through a software interface with the Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA) software installed at each medical facility to transmit the messages, via the Mailman communication interface, to the Austin Information Technology Center (AITC). An input linkage file is also received from FMS to obtain LAB cost. When received at Austin, the station’s messages are loaded to the Laboratory (LAB) LMI queue. A transmission consists of one or more messages. Each message is broken down into segments. Data is extracted from the queue into fixed byte segment records. These records are edited for content. Once the data has been edited, one output file is generated, containing good transactions and error messages.

laborHours.name: Patient Advocate Tracking System
laborHours.description: The Patient Advocate Tracking System (PATS) is used by Patient Advocates to ensure that all veterans and their families, who are served in VHA facilities and clinics, have their complaints addressed in a convenient and timely manner. The Patient Advocacy Program operates under the broader philosophy of Service Recovery, whereby patient complaints are identified, resolved, classified, and utilized to improve overall service to veterans. PATS is used to track information related to each Report of Contact (ROC) as well as the progress and resolution of each ROC.  PATS also produces reports that provide a quarterly assessment of complaint trends based on data from the Patient Advocate Tracking package, and provide linkages with satisfaction and other pertinent VHA data.

laborHours.name: Patient Advocate Tracking System Replacement
laborHours.description: The PATS-R application captures Interactions between Veterans or their beneficiaries and Patient Advocates through multiple channels. Patient Advocates can also leverage real-time Veteran feedback for effective service recovery. The feedback that Patient Advocates receive and manage is entered into PATS-R through multiple channels (both internal and external to the VA) such as in-person visits, phone calls or voicemails, emails, letters, and other systems such as the Medallia survey tool, Whitehouse.gov contact me, Veterans Crisis Line (VCL), and National Call Center for Homeless Veterans (NCCHV). Regardless of channel, the Patient Advocate can open, route, track, and close Interactions. The PATS-R application falls under the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Platform Enhancements Phase 2 Project umbrella.

laborHours.name: Patient Safety Assessment Tool
laborHours.description: Web application used by individuals at a facility to create a survey to proactively confirm the state of the system, and identify actions that the facility thinks it should take to maintain patient safety.  Often used in the field to ensure a 'ready state' for upcoming audits by The Joint Commission for hospital accreditation, specifically on the Sentinel Event Alerts (e.g., Alarm Safety). Additionally, PSAT is mandated by the Deputy Under Secretary for Health Operations Management (10N) for facilities to complete a yearly review of the Mental Health Environment of Care to ensure our mental health patients receive treatment in a safe environment. NCPS also requires facilities to complete yearly aggregate reviews of patient falls, medication errors, and wandering patients via the PSAT to implement and document best practices and lessons learned.

laborHours.name: Patient Safety Information and Reporting System
laborHours.description: Web-based reporting system developed over a decade ago to capture adverse patient events and root cause analysis. The reported event or close-call is risk scored, analyzed for the root cause, documents actions taken, and captures effectiveness of actions for Enterprise Learning; supports development, management, review, search, and trending of patient safety data at field, VISN, and National Center for Patient Safety (NCPS) facilities; including RCA's.

laborHours.name: Patient Treatment File
laborHours.description: Core component of VHA s health information architecture, providing source data on patient treatment and utilization. Primarily used by VA Medical Centers to report inpatient workload, demographics, diagnoses, and treatment information.

laborHours.name: Payroll Settlements Portal
laborHours.description: System to use data from CDW and timecards to conduct data analysis and calculations to ensure accuracy of calculating payments and generating payment files. We also need the ability to run customized historical reports for the payroll settlement process. Provide an output (pay data file) to be submitted to our payroll service provider (DFAS). Ability to push settlement data to the Customer Engagement Portal.

laborHours.name: PayVA
laborHours.description: PayVA, formerly known as VA Debt Management Center (QCR), is a site that collects basic debt information from users, redirects them to pay.gov for online payments and collects responses from pay.gov. This site will be hosted at https://www.pay.va.gov/ The production site with a secure certificate has already been created. It is a custom made application for DMC to verify debts are active at DMC before Veteran Makes a payment to avoid pay.va.gov over collecting and creating more refunds than were necessary.

laborHours.name: Performance Analysis and Integrity
laborHours.description: Performance Analysis and Integrity (PA&I) provides a reporting infrastructure, which serves data to thousands of users VBA-wide via a Web interface. PA&I is a component of the VBA VD2 application and is resident in an Oracle M5-32 server located at AITC. It provides the following reporting tools: Monthly Operations Reports, DOOR, HRIS, VR&E Intranet Reports, Education Workload Reports, VR&E Quality Assurance Reports, Loan Guaranty Reports (Servicing and TAS Reports), VOR 1.0, VOR 2.0, Veterans Business Information.

laborHours.name: Performance Data Warehouse
laborHours.description: Performance data warehouse providing performance measures

laborHours.name: Permanent Change of Station
laborHours.description: The Financial Services Center (FSC) developed the Permanent Change of Station (PCS) Travel Portal to streamline the process for initiating and approving documents required by relocating employees authorized PCS travel reimbursements. This application automates the process to prepare and submit an Intra-Agency Transfer Request, VA Form 5-3918, discretionary requests and approvals, budget requests and a Travel Authority for Permanent Duty, VA Form 3036c, for the traveler. This process applies to transferring employees and new appointees.This system is used to process permanent change of station travel. It is one of the many FSC systems that interact with FMS through the bi-directional “PC Interfaces”.The data starts with the station Human Resources (HR) department uploading a VA form 3918 to the PCS Travel Portal. Then, PCS personnel input the required information for PCS obligations and payments in the PCS Travel Portal. The PCS Travel Portal is the information records database that stores all information to be sent or that has been sent to interface with FMS. The process requires an edit validation check to determine if a file contains valid data. If errors are detected, the FSC – Program Management Office (PMO) can update the interfacing file for corrections to be processed on the next processing cycle.The PCS Travel portal is self-service. All employees in the agency can access it if needed.

laborHours.name: Personnel and Accounting Integrated Data
laborHours.description: The Personnel and Accounting Integrated Data (PAID) application is the Department of Veterans Affairs (VAs) legacy automated payroll system and served as the central system for support of human resources and payroll functions.  Day-to-day processing of HR data has been eliminated in the PAID application.  The PAID application continues to serve as the VA’s central repository for combined HR and Payroll data, and provides a stable source of information to support financial and other systems (i.e. FSC, FMS/FMBT, and VISTA).PAID now supports the HR Smart Application.HRSmart is a Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Shared Service Center (SSC) solution chosen in accordance with the federally mandated eGov initiatives (OMB directive).  It is replacing the capabilities of the HR portion of the legacy Personnel and Accounting Integrated Data (PAID) system), and provide additional capabilities in future releases.  The HRSmart effort will support personnel action processing, on-boarding, benefits management, and compensation management.  The system is hosted and supported by IBM and the first phase is being deployed.

laborHours.name: Personnel Information Exchange System
laborHours.description: A client/server application designed to improve the quality and timeliness of requesting veteran information from outside agencies. Information gained from these requests are used to process claims for: compensation, pension, education, burial benefits, and loan guaranty.  These improvements are achieved by automating and standardizing the data requests, improved routing, request tracking, standard output generation processes, and process metrics involved with claims development. PIES is an automated system that manages the requests for veteran information that are required in order to develop and process claims more efficiently. PIES consists of two executable programs:   PIES Create program   Developed for use by Regional Office and RMC users to create 3101 requests.   PIES Respond program   Developed for use by individuals at NPRC to respond to 3101 requests.  When a veteran submits a claim requiring service information or records not in VA custody, the VSR or other user at the VARO will open the PIES Create program. The user searches the PIES database for existing 3101s.

laborHours.name: Personnel Suitability and Security System
laborHours.description: [Received notification during the RVWG on October 19, 2017 that the Accreditation Boundary was being decommissioned. Confirmed with ISO on 10/26/2017] The Office of Personnel Security and Identity Management (PS&IM) is comprised of VA s Personnel Security and Suitability Service (PSS), Security and Investigations Center (SIC), and the HSPD-12 Program Office (HSPD-12) within the Office of Operations, Security and Preparedness (OSP). PS&IM ensures alignment, accountability, and transparency of VA s personnel security, suitability, and HSPD-12 programs and provides central coordination and oversight of the Department s personnel security, suitability, and identity management infrastructure. The Office of Personnel Security and Suitability (PSS) carries out the Department s responsibilities to maintain a personnel security program as authorized by laws, regulations, Executive Orders, and Directives at VA Central Office and throughout the Department.  PSS provides broad Department-wide policy direction, standard setting, coordination, and performance assessment for organizational components within VA and carries out VA s responsibilities to maintain a suitability program; including policy direction, standard setting, coordination, and performance assessment for organizational components for making suitability and fitness determinations within VA.

laborHours.name: Pharmacy Re-engineering
laborHours.description: Pharmacy Re-Engineering and IT Support is undergoing modernization as defined by the HealtheVet - VistA strategy. The Project scope is to replace current pharmacy software modules with new technology by re-engineering, new development and purchase of commercial products. In addition, this initiative aligns with the Services for Citizens category under the federal Business Reference Model, with a particular focus on the Health subcategory.

laborHours.name: PIV Card Management System
laborHours.description: The VA PIV System is a national and enterprise level solution that provides VA HSPD-12 PIV Card enrollment and issuance services.  The PIV System is constructed upon an enterprise capable Identity and Access Management solution, i.e., the Computer Associates (CA) Identity Manager product suite, which offers the VA tremendous capability in terms of identity lifecycle and security lifecycle management.   OSP is the business sponsor of the PIV system that provides the front end service to Customers at 204 PIV Offices VA wide and 80 mobile PIV stations.  OI&T and OIS provide operational security and maintenance of the PIV System Infrastructure.

laborHours.name: Planning and On-Line Activity/Release Integration Scheduler
laborHours.description: The POLARIS Enterprise Release Calendar shall begin a phased implementation across OI&amp;amp;T to become the single authoritative release calendar for all of OI&amp;amp;T. The POLARIS calendaring process and tool will be used to track software installations, hardware replacements, system upgrades, patch release and implementation, special works in progress, and other deployment events in the VA production environment….this Microsoft SharePoint-based application will serve as a central repository for production platform change information, release management coordination and deployment activity scheduling.

laborHours.name: Portal for Electronic Third-party Insurance Recovery
laborHours.description: Umbrella application for Electronic Data Interchange - Medical Care Cost Recovery Program (EDM), Lockbox (EPH), Insurance Identification and Verification (IIV), Pharmacy Insurance Claims (PHR), Streamlines the management of multiple components, including simplification of documentation for security, disaster recovery, and privacy.

laborHours.name: Portfolio Classification and Reporting Tool
laborHours.description: Research Administrative Management System (RAMS) - The Office of Research and Development (ORD) is responsible for the management and administration of the national VA intramural research program and ensuring that the research portfolio is responsive to the needs of VA, VHA, and Veterans. ORD aims to improve the efficiency and performance of the national VA research program by implementing a portfolio classification and reporting tool. A portfolio categorization and reporting tool will enable ORD to capture and translate data more rapidly, which will provide a higher level of responsiveness to governmental agencies monitoring research compliance issues, Congressional inquiries, and VA executive management. The tool will provide the analytic capability to evaluate VAs research program for areas of strength, influence, trends, gaps, and new opportunities. The tool will facilitate the peer review process by identifying appropriate reviewers. The tool will also provide a public web-based reporter function.

laborHours.name: Presidential Memorial Certification - Redesign
laborHours.description: A project to enhance the current PMC screen to improve case processing functionality, to provide case tracking, productivity reporting and document tracking reports for the PMC program. A Presidential Memorial Certificate (PMC) is an engraved paper certificate, bearing the signature of the current President, to honor the memory of Veterans who have been honorably discharged from the Armed Forces of the United States.

laborHours.name: Primary Care Staffing
laborHours.description: Link to view reports generated from the Primary Care Staffing and Rooms Database, as well as modify and add divisions to the PC Staffing and Rooms Database. Access to view the reports is not limited; however, access to modify the database is limited to VISN designees.

laborHours.name: Primary Domain Controller
laborHours.description: Provides Primary domain controllers on the LAN/WAN. Domain controllers provide authorization to services on the domain.

laborHours.name: Prior Year Recovery Automation
laborHours.description: The Prior Year Recovery (PYR) Automation application will automate the Prior Year Recovery (PYR) process by extracting the relevant transactions from FMS, generate the appropriate corrections, and post them to FMS so that the FSC reduces audit exceptions. The corrections are aimed at reducing unnecessary over/understatement of the year end obligation balances.

laborHours.name: Program Integrity - Case Assignment Tracking Tool
laborHours.description: Used to track fraudulent health care claims.

laborHours.name: Project Management Accountability System Dashboard
laborHours.description: UPDATED by the VTWG on 17 July 2018: PMAS has been replaced by VIP as the authoritative source for VA project tracking. However, PMAS remains an active system for accessibility to legacy project data. PMAS provided guidance for planning, management control, processes and roles and responsibilities for VA IT projects. PMAS Dashboard tracked and reported PMAS project increment deliverable dates, cost and status; content for Monthly Progress Reports, centralized project scheduling tool and supported automated updates to OMB IT Dashboard.

laborHours.name: Provider Portal
laborHours.description: Web application used by FSC staff and external providers to access Explanation of Benefits (EOB) information for services previously rendered. The EOB's are made available in advance of the paper EOB's received by the vendors and allow them to reconcile services to payments. Staff Portal have their own screens that allow them extended access to information for all providers so that they may provide phone help to the vendors.

laborHours.name: Public Key Infrastructure
laborHours.description: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) is responsible for attesting to the identity of Users, Computers and organization. PKI is a set of roles, policies, hardware, software and procedures needed to create, manage, distribute, use, store and revoke digital certificates and manage public-key encryption. The Certificate Authority (CA) issuing digital signed certificate which does the function of manage, revoke and renew certificates for entire Enterprise of Veterans Affairs.

laborHours.name: Purchase Order Management System
laborHours.description: Manages the VCS (Veterans' Canteen Service) inventory for 170 sites across the United States and Puerto Rico. VCS provides quality retail items, food, and services at reasonable prices to patients, caregivers, and visitors of VAMCs.

laborHours.name: Purchased Care Health Administration Center Utilities
laborHours.description: Content management system for role based management for the multitude of Java and .NET applications as well as administrative access to various article based pages on the CBOPC.

laborHours.name: QE Date Calculator
laborHours.description: Calculates the Qualifying Event (QE) Date.

laborHours.name: Quality Assurance Web Application
laborHours.description: A VBA/VRE Intranet application which captures the results of both national and local case reviews.  This application facilitates detailed analysis of case review results, online linking to regulations, manuals, training systems, best practices repository, and tracking of CER folders. This application is a candidate for replacement starting in FY10.

laborHours.name: Quality Evaluation System
laborHours.description: The Quality Evaluation System (QUEST) streamlines the quality review process of Consolidated Patient Account Center (CPAC) employees and reports on compliance trends, root cause analysis, and identified training issues for further improving adherence to CPAC Revenue Collection processes and procedures. CPAC supervisors use QUEST to conduct assessments of their employees’ work to be sure that their work is meeting the rules, guidance, and standards for processing claims for the VA.

laborHours.name: Rating Board Automation 2000
laborHours.description: 6/8/17: Per email received and CTO Memo dated 5/6/2017, RBA2000 has been Decommissioned; therefore, it has been marked as INACTIVE RBA2000 is the replacement system for the Rating Board Automation (RBA) application in use nationwide to support the preparation of disability rating decisions. RBA2000, unlike its predecessor, is integrated with VETSNET specifications for award processing and data storage formats and will provide improved support for the creation of text documents needed to document rating decisions.  RBA2000 will continue the collection of claims data to support both information and budgetary requirements. RBA2000 incorporates the latest rating decision format and transfers disability and entitlement data into a corporate database of claimants who have applied for VA benefits. We have added features that provide decision makers with more flexibility in their choice of rating narrative input.

laborHours.name: Readjustment Counseling Service Network
laborHours.description: Readjustment Counseling Service Network (RCSnet) is a special purpose program within Veterans Health Administration which has a mandated separate system of records that tracks and documents professional readjustment counseling, community education and outreach to special populations. RCN is the web interface which provides online management for administrating this separate system in a dedicated Readjustment Counseling Service facility.

laborHours.name: Real Property Project Tracking System
laborHours.description: The Real Property Project Tracking System (RPPTS) is a lease tracking tool used by our Real Property Service to manage their lease program.  RPPTS uses a SQL Server database with a .Net front-end.

laborHours.name: Records Retrieval System
laborHours.description: Records Retrieval System (RRS) is an online web application that facilitates and tracks record transmittals and receipts. RRS allows users to complete, save, and print online VA record request forms VA 0244 and VA 0245 used by the Records Center and Vault (RC&amp;V). Record transmittal request forms VA 0244, and VA 0245 can be completed, saved, and printed online, expediting and streamlining RC&amp;V services. These forms document the transfer of records to the RC&amp;V and document requests for files or information from records stored at the RC&amp;V. The RRS system uses a Java web service client application hosted on an AITC Windows server to send data from the local RRS database to the national RRS database. VA RC&amp;V supports NARA/ Neosho, MO.

laborHours.name: Recovery Audit
laborHours.description: Software used to recoup funds from payments to providers.

laborHours.name: Referral Authorization System
laborHours.description: The Referral Authorization System (RAS) is a sub-system of HCPS #1322. RAS provides a bi-directional interface with CPRS for referral processes with HCPS Dialysis Referrals and Authorizations. RAS is triggered after a VA Provider completes and electronically signs Non-VA Care Hemodialysis or Peritonial dialysis consult in CPRS #1789. RAS includes Referral functionality to verify eligibility, perform clinical review, add contracted Non-VA Provider, approve or reject referral in HCPS. RAS includes Authorization functionality to schedule appointments, reserve funds in IFCAP obligation and print/send correspondence to Veteran and Non-VA Provider. RAS includes updates to authorization Non-VA Provider, number of visits, frequency, authorization period, purpose of visit and Procedure and Diagnosis Codes.

laborHours.name: Reinstated Entitlement Program for Survivors
laborHours.description: (Per VASI IO on the 08142018 VTWG, system functionality to Corporate Database #1153) This program Legislation was originally passed as an amendment to public Law 97-377 for the sole purpose of restoring Social Security Administration benefits to surviving spouses and/or school children of members or former members of the armed forces who died while on active duty before August 13, 1981, or whose death after discharge was the result of a disability incurred or aggravated by military service before that date.  The restored benefits are funded by the DoD and administered by the VA. The REPS database is updated on a weekly basis by daily on-line transactions originating at the St. Louis Regional Office.  Three reports are also produced to control this processing.  On the 5th workday before the end of the month, full file processing is performed creating recurring monthly payment records, a voucher, nine reports reflecting financial and other personnel status information, and a DOD tape that is sent to the Defense Manpower Data Center in Monterey, California. Payment and finance processing is done at the St. Louis RO.  In fiscal 2003, REPS issued 5,279 payments totaling over $7 million.

laborHours.name: Release of Names and Addresses
laborHours.description: The system is a web-based applications which automates the Release of Names and Addresses process and tracks each request.

laborHours.name: Remote Access Information and Media Portal
laborHours.description: The Remote Access Information and Media Portal (RAIMP) is a web application, available both internally and externally, that provides general remote access communication and assistance, including FAQs ad User Guides. Software is also available for download. The site requires Active Directory (AD) authentication (supports PIV).

laborHours.name: Remote Access Management Portal
laborHours.description: Formerly, ISO VPN Portal, the Remote Access Management Portal (RAMP) supports all aspects of client (user) remote access.  RAMP includes an ISO Portal, where ISOs audit the remote access process, an Approving Official Portal, where remote access requests are approved or denied and user settings are managed; a Self Service Portal, where users request remote access, upload documents, etc.; and a Portal Support component where Enterprise Service Desk and IT Support personnel have access to remote access user information and features to assist users.

laborHours.name: Remote Order Entry System
laborHours.description: This is a VistA application used by clinicians to place orders for certain types of medical products and services that are maintained under contract by the Denver Distribution Center (DDC). ROES maintains an indirect interface to FMS through Gentran. ROES doesn’t actually interface with FMS. Financial data (billing and vendor payments) is sent to the Austin Finance Center and they process it in FMS.  Clinical programs supported by ROES include Audiology and Speech Pathology, Prosthetic and Sensory Aids, and Telehealth Services.

laborHours.name: Report of VA Medical Training Programs
laborHours.description: [Per the 02122019 VTWG, system does not exist. It was a one time use report] Provides information for making staffing decisions. Provides total count of full and part time VA physicians serving as faculty. Provides the number of medical students by medical center. Provides a total count of foreign medical students and graduates. Provides medical graduate reporting by specialty (medical, geriatric, surgery, etc.) and sub-specialty.

laborHours.name: Research Administrative Management System
laborHours.description: The Research Administrative Management System (RAMS) is based on a SharePoint architecture that will provide new services for end users with integrated services across the VA ORD, centralized information, centralized reporting, and replace or integrate legacy systems such as ePROMISe and RCMS. RAMS is intended as a multipurpose tool for ORD Central Office and VA Medical Center (VAMC) field research offices. The requirements specify the capability to create and track administrative data for each project assigned to the local research office, manage research oversight committees and subcommittees, track research personnel assignments, training requirements and certifications, manage laboratory data including space allocations and equipment, and support required reporting to ORD.

laborHours.name: Research and Development Information System
laborHours.description: The Research and Development Information System (RDIS) application is used to collect projects, investigators and funding data as well as for querying by all Program offices within CO. It collects data from the field via the ePROMISe application. In addition, it tracks data submitted by VA research stations for funding requests for R and D research projects and is used to track expenses and provides summary reports for all of VA to Congress based on key word groupings. It allows for querying against project, investigator, funding, career development and merit review data based on standard search functions.

laborHours.name: Research Compliance Review Solution
laborHours.description: Case management system that collects data used to oversee medical research providing detailed and summarized compliance metrics. Database to collect and store data on VHA research program regulatory compliance/non-compliance.  Data is entered as a case, specific to a particular research program, and follows each identified issue through to resolution of said issue(s).  Routine reports are generated for VA/VHA leadership and Congress.  Stored data is mined as part of the ORO risk model which identifies issues which may put research programs at greater risk of regulatory non-compliance.  PII/PHI is not collected.

laborHours.name: Research Electronic Data Capture
laborHours.description: VA REDCap (Research Electronic Data Capture) is a web-based application hosted and maintained by the VA Informatics and Computing Infrastructure (VINCI) and VA Information Resource Center (VIReC). This tool helps researchers easily create online databases and surveys so that they may systematically collect, store, manage, and export their project data for analysis without requiring knowledge of a programming language. Users have flexibility in creating and designing surveys and data collection forms using an approach appropriate to their project.  VA REDCap surveys can be made accessible to anyone within the VA Intranet using any web browser without additional software, or a data entry form can be set up with restricted permission to specific users to view or modify the data. Other benefits include data quality control, secure storage, maintenance and sharing of data on the REDCap server, and consistent formatting across all sites with validation and branching/skipping logic.

laborHours.name: Research Management System
laborHours.description: WinRMS is a computer software system designed to assist VA Research Field Offices in administering funding for VA Research. WinRMS was developed by the Research and Development Computing Center (RDCC) in Baltimore. If WinRMS is installed within the VistA network on a secure computer, expense data can be downloaded from the VistA IFCAP, FMS, and PAID systems.

laborHours.name: Resolution Letters
laborHours.description: Per VASI SO, system is no longer active on the server. Amy Mersereau-Cooper 05292018.  The resolution letters provides each applicant notification of the suspense or disapproval of the submitted application for a government headstone, marker or medallion along with Veterans Claims Assistance Act information and appeal rights are included as appropriate with the letters.  The resolution letters are generated with minimal manual intervention from Memorial Programs Service (MPS) case managers and result in the standardization of the letters across the MPS Processing sites.

laborHours.name: Resolution Management Systems Infrastructure
laborHours.description: Migration of VmWare (which encompasses the virtual machines used to run the Complaints Automated Tracking System and Alternative Dispute Resolution Tracker applications) from the current VBLOCKS environment to the Azure Cloud. An assessment of the current virtual infrastructure is also needed to determine the viability to perform in the cloud environment.

laborHours.name: Retail, Accounting, Procurement, Technology with Organizational Reporting [NOT A SYSTEM]
laborHours.description: Per VTWG and VASI IO on 6/25/2019, the system is marked as not as a system and added as a component of Veterans Canteen Service Automated Information System (VCS AIS) - #1731. This application will support the operation of 172 canteens at VA medical centers across the country by tracking and reporting on retail, food, vending services and catalog orders to VA patients and caregivers.  Run US Treasury files daily, EDI files daily, Sales logs daily, POS downloads and uploads. Replaced FMIS.

laborHours.name: Review of Quality
laborHours.description: [Per C. Holt at the 10-23-2018 VTWG, system is now inactive. Retirement CO: CO494374FY18 was provided.] VBA Intranet application that captures the results of both national and local case reviews for Entitlement Determination/Rehabilitation Planning, Rehabilitation Services Delivery, Outcomes, and Educational/Vocational Counseling

laborHours.name: Rules-Based Processing System
laborHours.description: RBPS is a batch job that reads data input from eBenefits, SHARE, VRM and soon to be D2D.  The veteran or the VA user enters information to fill out a 21-686c or 21-674 Form using one of those systems and some of those systems create a PDF of the claim for Virtual VA.  RBPS starts every half hour, reads that data and determines if enough information has been submitted to process the claim to add/remove the dependent(s).  If the claim/data passes all of the rules, the dependent can be added/modified and the award regenerated /authorized for a payment change (could be less pay if a dependent is being removed, such as a spouse, or more if adding).  There are lots of exceptions that can cause the process to reset the claim type to a “Manual” claim type where a VSR would review it.  If the Award is successful, changes are sent to the Financial Accounting System, the letter is generated, saved, and transferred to Print and to Virtual VA.

laborHours.name: ScImage
laborHours.description: The login to the ScImage application is the identity verification process. Each individual physician's credentials (NPI) are part of the ScImage user profile.

laborHours.name: Search and Participant Profile
laborHours.description: Search and Participant Profile (SPP) provides the ability to locate Veteran, Claim, and/or Family Member records.  The user may locate a record by performing a search by a File Number, Social Security Number, or Taxpayer ID Number.  This search functionality includes a real-time interface between VETSNET and BIRLS.  The Search function identifies all participants related to the search criteria.  The search results offer a simple interface to detailed profile information about the participants found.  Participants include veterans, family members, fiduciaries, and other associated groups and organizations.  Participant information can be added or updated by accessing the appropriate profile.  SPP functionality is being moved incrementally into the SHARE application, which is also used to establish claims and maintain addresses and fiduciaries for both BDN and VETSNET.

laborHours.name: Self Contained eLearning Results
laborHours.description: Software used to manage Chief Business Office Purchased Care (CBOPC) internal web-based training programs.

laborHours.name: Service Medical Records Tracking System
laborHours.description: Service Medical Records are transferred directly from military separation centers to the St. Louis Records Management Center (RMC) within 10 workdays of service members separation from active duty. Service Medical Record Tracking System (SMRTS) is an online automated system that is the receipt, control, maintenance, and disposition of the service members  records. Under a Memorandum of Understanding with the Department of Defense (DoD), VA is required to return records associated with a DoD mobilization to sites determined by DoD within 72 hours of notification that a service member/veteran will be recalled to active duty. Using Web SMR, the Defense Manpower Data Center (DMDC), via its website, will request from VBA, SMRs for recall. VBA will download the file from its website; search the Beneficiary Identification and Record Locator Subsystem (BIRLS) for the location of the SMRs; connect to the Web SMR SQL server database to update the appropriate table(s); and notify the appropriate regional office (or VA s Records Management Center (RMC), if applicable) via e-mail to process the request.  The regional offices (or RMC) will then use the Web SMR application to view pending requests, mail the folders to appropriate addresses, and update the request with tracking information (e.g., FEDEX information, number of volumes sent, etc.).

laborHours.name: Services Request Form
laborHours.description: The Services Request Form (SRF) is used to submit and route NT and VistA access requests through the proper HR and ISO approvals for new, existing and transferring CPAC Employees and Contractors.

laborHours.name: SF1184 Payment Tracking and Recertification
laborHours.description: The SF-1184 (standard form for Unavailable Check Cancellation) Payment Tracking and Recertification System is designed to automate the inputting, processing, and tracking of checks for claims of non-receipt. Payment resolution will daily transmit an outgoing file to Treasury for processing. Treasury will provide results in a file of each claim and update items in the system with status of each check and payment resolution.

laborHours.name: Share
laborHours.description: A Microsoft Windows-based client/server application that allows regional office employees to inquiry against legacy information such as the Beneficiary Information Locater System (BIRLS), Benefits Delivery Network (BDN), and other agencies  information (e.g. SSA).  Share updates both legacy and corporate information with one transaction.  This application is the starting point of MAP-D.  Share is maintained by VETSNET Team 2, Austin, TX.

laborHours.name: Shift Handoff Tool
laborHours.description: The Shift Handoff Tool is a utility that assists hospital staff going off shift to create a report for the incoming shift. This report contains demographic and medical information about each patient being handed off. At a minimum it shows medications and allergies, but can be customized to show other medical information that is relevant to the patient s condition. [Moved to System Component/Application for 1849: CPRS on 09/18/2015; per Vitalia Devlin changed status back to Active on 10312017]

laborHours.name: Site Implementation Tracking
laborHours.description: The Site Implementation Tracking database is a module on the VA national electronic mail system FORUM that tracks when Veterans Affairs Medical Center (VAMC) sites install a new version of a Veterans Health Information Systems and Technology Architecture (VistA).

laborHours.name: Social Security Number Reduction
laborHours.description: The SSNR tool enables VA enterprise to identify SSN usage within VA in any media. This will enable VA to identify SSN usage within VA with the goal of eliminating the use of SSN as an identifier.

laborHours.name: Space Management Application
laborHours.description: Office of Administration manages buildings on multiple campuses with various tenants. This application is designed to manage the building space, update architectural drawings, create invoices for tenants, and report various historical trends upon request.

laborHours.name: Special Adaptive Housing / Special Housing Adaptation
laborHours.description: SAHSHA is a web application that is a sub application of LGY and is accessed via the LGY front-end application (either VIP or LGY Hub). It is used by VA LGY employees and inspectors outside of the VA to manage SAH grant information for veterans applying for and/or receiving grants to adapt their housing. There are two types of grants SAH and SHA thus the acronym SAHSHA.

laborHours.name: Staff Directory
laborHours.description: Provides an interface to the Exchange server for the business to quickly look up and manage departmental employees.

laborHours.name: Stakeholder Information Management System
laborHours.description: Tool used by LGY to manage business partners such as lenders, appraisers, and servicers

laborHours.name: Stakeholders Enterprise Portal
laborHours.description: Enterprise portal and entry point for VA business partners.  This portal is to support various stakeholders such as Veterans, providers etc. and will utilize VONAPP for self service front end..

laborHours.name: Standards and COTS Integration Platform (formerly Bidirectional Health Information Exchange)
laborHours.description: The Bidirectional Health Information Exchange (BHIE) system has been enhanced to provide additional functionality in support of the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). This enhancement has led to a change in the system name to reflect the additional functionality. The system is now known as the Standards and COTS Integration Platform (SCIP). SCIP is a middleware hardware and software framework that provides a secure, bidirectional, real-time interagency exchange of clinical data and patient demographics between VA and DoD health information systems. Hosted within the SCIP enclave, each with a unique interagency data sharing purpose are the following systems: SCIP Framework, SCIP Station 200, and interagency image sharing functions. The SCIP Framework middleware systems consist of various components and applications that pass unclassified patient data bidirectionally between VA and DoD. Some of the key components of the SCIP Framework include: External communication adapter (XCA), Doc Search XCA, XCA Data Services, Clinical/Health Data Repository (CHDR) Active Dual Consumer (ADC) Feed, etc. This Interagency functionality is implemented at an enterprise level and deployed globally. VistA is the end-user interface for VA. SCIP was upgraded to provide the current middleware that facilitates the transfer of clinical information from the DoD’s Essentris system, Clinical Data Repository (CDR) and the Theater Medical Data Store (TMDS) to the VA’s Computerized Patient Record Service (CPRS) Remote Data Views (RDV) and VistAWeb. This project added improved functionality for VA clinicians to view DoD inpatient data via the VA CPRS RDV Graphical User Interface (GUI) and now includes medical images as of FY2008 and beyond in other Government projects. Subsequent SCIP enhancements further improved SCIP functionality to support additional data types and data sources such as numerous Secure Healthcare Alliance Record Exchange (SHARE) sites, Health Artifact and Image Management Solution (HAIMS), and Central VistA Imaging Exchange (CVIX). SCIP is hosted at CRRC in Martinsburg, WV, while its Alternate Processing Site (APS) is located at SRDC in Secaucus, NJ.

laborHours.name: State Veterans Home Survey
laborHours.description: VA currently utilizes a two-part SVH software program to create, package, download, score, upload, store, and finalize all SVH surveys until VACO review and closure. The SVH survey software program uses a client application that is a locally-installed component of an n-tier system used to enter all survey ratings or findings and recommendations for each specific SVH survey to provide a legal survey report back per federal regulation and upload that survey data collected by the users to get back to the assigned SVH. The application is a Microsoft VB.NET 2.0 program utilizing a Microsoft SQL LocalDB install for the collecting and processing of data. Survey report results are uploaded back to the State Veterans Home database/website - SHOST (located on the VA intranet: vaww.svhsurvey.cc.med.va.gov/svh) using HTTP/Simple Object Access Protocol. This method is the only way to print or provide an official legal survey report back to our state veteran home partners per federal regulation.

laborHours.name: Strategic Capital Investment Planning
